Which of the following statements about spreadsheet software (MS-EXCEL) are true?(1) Data in spreadsheets are always correct.(2) Spreadsheet software cannot draw bar graphs.(3) Spreadsheet software automatically recalculates.(4) Some cells in a spreadsheet can be locked to prevent a user from changing its contents.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.1 and 2 only
  • B.3 and 4 only
  • C.1 and 3 only
  • D.2 and 4 only
Correct Answer: 3 and 4 only

Spreadsheet software like MS Excel is designed to automatically recalculate formulas and functions whenever changes are made to the data, ensuring that the results are always updated in real time. Additionally, Excel allows users to lock specific cells to prevent unauthorized or accidental changes, which is especially useful in shared or protected worksheets. On the other hand, the assumption that spreadsheet data is always correct is false—accuracy depends on the correctness of the input and formulas. Also, Excel can draw bar graphs and many other types of charts.

 

Thus, statements (1) and (2) are incorrect.

Question 36
Which of the following is the correct chronological order of the earliest to latest of different acts according to their year of enactment in India?(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.The Environment Protection Act, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act
  • B.Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, The Environment Protection Act, Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act
  • C.Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, The Environment Protection Act, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act
  • D.Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, The Environment Protection Act
Correct Answer: Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, The Environment Protection Act

The correct chronological order of the acts according to their year of enactment in India is:

Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act – enacted in 1974

Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act – enacted in 1981

The Environment Protection Act – enacted in 1986.

Thus, D is the correct answer.

Question 37
Benefits of biodiesel over petrodiesel are:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)(1) Biodiesel contains virtually no sulfur(2) Biodiesel emits substantially lower carbon monoxide (CO)(3) Biodiesel is a better lubricant than petrodiesel(4) Biodiesel emits significantly lower Oxides of Nitrogen Oxides (NOₓ) than petrodiesel(5) Particulate emission by biodiesel is much lower than that of petrodieselChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.1, 2, 3, 4 only
  • B.2, 3, 4, 5 only
  • C.1, 2, 3, 5 only
  • D.1, 2, 4, 5 only
Correct Answer: 1, 2, 3, 5 only

1. Biodiesel is almost sulfur-free, which helps in reducing sulfur dioxide emissions.

2. Biodiesel combustion produces significantly lower CO emissions compared to petrodiesel.

3. Biodiesel improves lubrication in engines, reducing wear and tear.

4. Biodiesel emits significantly lower NOₓ than petrodiesel is False. In fact, biodiesel can emit slightly higher levels of nitrogen oxides (NOₓ) in some cases.

5. Biodiesel combustion produces fewer particulate emissions, which is better for air quality.

Thus, C is the correct answer.

Question 38
Which of the following came as alternatives to chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) as refrigerants?(1) Hydrofluorocarbons(2) Perfluorocarbons(3) Hydrochlorofluorocarbons(4) HalonsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.1, 2 and 3 only
  • B.2, 3 and 4 only
  • C.2 and 4 only
  • D.1 and 3 only
Correct Answer: 1 and 3 only

Question 39
Which of the following is true about an over-fertile lake?(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Nitrate level decreases
  • B.Depletion in algal productivity
  • C.Oxygen level increases
  • D.Quality of fishes produced is impaired
Correct Answer: Quality of fishes produced is impaired

An over-fertile lake (a condition known as eutrophication) occurs due to excessive nutrients, especially nitrates and phosphates, entering the water. This leads to rapid growth of algae (algal bloom). When algae die and decompose, it reduces oxygen levels in the water. This results in poor water quality and stressful conditions for aquatic life, especially fish. Thus, the quality of fishes produced is impaired.

Thus, Option D is the correct answer.

Question 40
Temporary hardness in water is also known as:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Sulphate hardness
  • B.Nitrate hardness
  • C.Chloride hardness
  • D.Carbonate hardness
Correct Answer: Carbonate hardness

Temporary hardness in water is caused by the presence of dissolved bicarbonates of calcium and magnesium. It is called carbonate hardness because these bicarbonates decompose upon boiling, forming carbonates, which precipitate out and thus remove the hardness.

 

Sulphate, nitrate, and chloride hardness are forms of permanent hardness, which cannot be removed by boiling.

Question 41
Under the Universities Act of 1904, universities were given the authority to recognise:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.School boards
  • B.Literacy missions
  • C.Elementary schools
  • D.Secondary schools
Correct Answer: Secondary schools

The correct answer is (D) Secondary schools.

 

Under the Universities Act of 1904, universities were granted the authority to recognize secondary schools. This allowed universities to oversee and regulate the quality of education at the secondary level, helping to standardize educational practices across regions.

Question 42
Which of the following are the subjects taught at ancient Nalanda University?(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)A. AstronomyB. AyurvedaC. MathematicsD. MedicineChoose the correct answer from the options:
  • A.A and B
  • B.A, B, and C
  • C.A, C and D
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

Nalanda University was an ancient center of learning, located in present-day Bihar, India. It flourished from the 5th to the 12th century CE and was one of the most prominent educational institutions of its time, attracting students and scholars from across Asia, including China, Korea, Japan, Tibet, Mongolia, Turkey, Sri Lanka, and Southeast Asia.

 

Subjects taught at Nalanda University were medicine, Ayurveda, Buddhism, mathematics, grammar, astronomy, and Indian philosophy.

Question 43
What was National Knowledge Commission's recommendations for minimum gross enrolment ratio to be achieved in higher education by 2015?(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.5 percent
  • B.10 percent
  • C.15 percent
  • D.20 percent
Correct Answer: 15 percent

Option C is the correct answer.

 

The National Knowledge Commission report includes detailed recommendations as given below:

  • The higher education system needs a massive expansion of opportunities, to around 1500 universities nationwide, that would enable India to attain a gross enrolment ratio of at least 15 per cent by 2015.
  • The present regulatory system in higher education is, as a whole, is over-regulated but under-governed. We believe that there is a clear need to establish an Independent Regulatory Authority for Higher Education (IRAHE).
  • The expansion of the system of higher education is not possible without enhanced levels of financing. This must necessarily come from both public and private sources.
  • Establish 50 National Universities that can provide education of the highest standard.
  • The endeavor to transform higher education must reform existing institutions.
  • The system of affiliated colleges for undergraduate education, is no longer adequate and needs to be reformed. Indeed, there is an urgent need to restructure the system of undergraduate colleges.
  • An expansion of higher education, which provides students with choices and creates competition between institutions is going to be vital in enhancing accountability.
  • It recommended setting up of a National Science and Social Science Foundation (NSSF) for producing research work that can fetch a Nobel Prize for an Indian scientist.
Question 44
Which of the following are the functions of Indian Council of Social Science Research?(1) Encourage delinking of social sciences from natural sciences(2) Provide scholarship for research in social sciences(3) Give financial support to institutional journals of research(4) Promote social science research(5) Blacklist non-performing social science institutions from time to timeChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.1, 2 and 3 only
  • B.2, 3 and 4 only
  • C.3, 4 and 5 only
  • D.1, 4 and 5 only
Correct Answer: 2, 3 and 4 only

The correct answer is option (B) - 2, 3 and 4 only.

 

The Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR) performs several key functions to promote and support research in social sciences:

  • Provide scholarship for research in social sciences – True
  • Give financial support to institutional journals of research – True
  • Promote social science research – True
Question 45
The period between 1200 and 1764 AD was remarkable in India for the highest distinction attained by:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Popular literature
  • B.Vernacular literature
  • C.English literature
  • D.French literature
Correct Answer: Vernacular literature

The correct answer is: (B) Vernacular literature

 

Between 1200 and 1764 AD, India saw a significant rise in vernacular literature—literature written in regional languages such as Hindi, Bengali, Tamil, Telugu, Marathi, and others. This period was marked by:

 

The Bhakti and Sufi movements, which inspired poetry and devotional songs in local languages.

 

Eminent poets like Tulsidas, Kabir, Surdas, Mirabai, and Chandidas wrote in vernacular languages, making literature accessible to the common people.

 

Growth of regional literary traditions and court patronage in various kingdoms.

 

This era contributed immensely to Indian culture and identity through literature in languages spoken by the masses.

Question 46
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown.The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size is also due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain’s development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow till:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Elementary school years
  • B.Early childhood
  • C.Adulthood
  • D.Adolescence
Correct Answer: Adolescence

The passage clearly states:

 

“The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence.”

 

This means growth continues up to adolescence, making option (D) Adolescence the correct choice.

Question 47
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown.The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size is also due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain’s development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.Which of the following facts about Myelination are correct?(1) It increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system.(2) It is responsible for increase in size of the brain.(3) It is completed in all areas of the brain by age four.(4) Knowledge about it dies not benefit us in any way.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.3 and 4 only
  • B.2, 3 and 4 only
  • C.1 and 2 only
  • D.1, 3 and 4 only
Correct Answer: 1 and 2 only

Let’s verify each statement using the passage:

 

(1) It increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system.

Correct – The passage says:

“This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system.”

 

(2) It is responsible for increase in size of the brain.

Correct – The passage mentions:

“Some of the brain's increase in size is also due to myelination.”

 

(3) It is completed in all areas of the brain by age four.

Incorrect – The passage clearly states:

“Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age... [and] focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years.”

 

(4) Knowledge about it does not benefit us in any way.

Incorrect – The passage discusses teaching implications, showing that this knowledge is indeed useful.

 

Thus, option (C) is correct.

Question 48
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown.The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size is also due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain’s development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.Which of the following facts regarding synaptic connections are correct?(1) Connections that are used are weakened.(2) Twice as many connections are made than will ever be used.(3) Unused connections either disappear or are replaced by other pathways.(4) Connections that are used perish.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.1, 2 and 4 only
  • B.2 and 3 only
  • C.1 and 4 only
  • D.2, 3 and 4 only
Correct Answer: 2 and 3 only

Let’s examine each statement based on the passage:

 

(1) Connections that are used are weakened.

Incorrect – The passage says the opposite:

“The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive...”

 

(2) Twice as many connections are made than will ever be used.

Correct – The passage states:

“Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.”

 

(3) Unused connections either disappear or are replaced by other pathways.

Correct – As per the passage:

“The unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.”

 

(4) Connections that are used perish.

Incorrect – The passage clearly says they survive and are strengthened.

 

Thus, option (B) is correct.

Question 49
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown.The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size is also due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain’s development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.As children grow their attention span focus:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Remains static
  • B.Improves
  • C.Declines insignificantly
  • D.Declines significantly
Correct Answer: Improves

The passage clearly states:

 

“Children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years.”

Question 50
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown.The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size is also due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain’s development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.Synapses are considered as:(UGC NET 02 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Timely gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made.
  • B.An element responsible for blood circulation in the brain.
  • C.Large gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made.
  • D.One and only particle of the brain related to hand-eye coordination.
Correct Answer: Timely gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made.

The passage states:

 

"Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Quiz Attempt #119710

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of viewers of JI0 TV channel in five different towns (A, B, C, D and E) along with the number of viewers who subscribed the channel among them in the year 2023. Number of viewers in the town E is 1200. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: For each town, number of channel viewers is the sum of number of viewers who subscribed for the channel and the number of viewers who did not subscribe for the channel.If the number of male unsubscribed viewers in Town-D is2003% more than that of female unsubscribed viewers, then what is the ratio of number of male unsubscribed viewers in Town-D to the number of unsubscribed viewers in Town-A and Town-C together?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.25 : 53
  • B.25 : 54
  • C.7 : 9
  • D.2 : 3
Correct Answer: 25 : 54

Total Viewers = 12000.2 = 6000

Let female unsubscribed = x

Then, male unsubscribed = x + 23x = 5x3

Now, x + 5x3 = 800

or x = 300

So, male unsubscribed = 500

Required ratio = 500280+800 = 25 : 54

Question 2
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of viewers of JI0 TV channel in five different towns (A, B, C, D and E) along with the number of viewers who subscribed the channel among them in the year 2023. Number of viewers in the town E is 1200. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: For each town, number of channel viewers is the sum of number of viewers who subscribed for the channel and the number of viewers who did not subscribe for the channel.If P is the total number of unsubscribed viewers in Town-B and Town-C together, and Q is the number of subscribed viewers in Town-E, then Q is _____ % less than P.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.65
  • B.80
  • C.60
  • D.70
Correct Answer: 70

Total Viewers = 12000.2 = 6000

P = 400 + 800 = 1200

Q = 360

Percentage less = 1200-3601200×100 = 70%

Question 3
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of viewers of JI0 TV channel in five different towns (A, B, C, D and E) along with the number of viewers who subscribed the channel among them in the year 2023. Number of viewers in the town E is 1200. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: For each town, number of channel viewers is the sum of number of viewers who subscribed for the channel and the number of viewers who did not subscribe for the channel.If out of the number of viewers from Town-C,3257% are female and713of the number of female viewers are unsubscribed viewers, then the number of unsubscribed male viewers from Town-C is.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.340
  • B.360
  • C.380
  • D.420
Correct Answer: 380

Total Viewers = 12000.2 = 6000

Viewers from town C = 1680

 

Female unsubscribed viewers = 3257% of 713 of 1680 = 420

Total unsubscribed viewers in Town-C = 1680 – 880 = 800

Unsubscribed males = 800 − 420 = 380

Question 4
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of viewers of JI0 TV channel in five different towns (A, B, C, D and E) along with the number of viewers who subscribed the channel among them in the year 2023. Number of viewers in the town E is 1200. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: For each town, number of channel viewers is the sum of number of viewers who subscribed for the channel and the number of viewers who did not subscribe for the channel.What is the difference between the number of unsubscribed viewers and subscribed viewers, taking all the towns together?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.320
  • B.240
  • C.340
  • D.300
Correct Answer: 240

Total Viewers = 12000.2 = 6000

Total viewers = 6000

Unsubscribed = 6000 – 2880 = 3120

Difference = 3120 – 2880 = 240

Question 5
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of viewers of JI0 TV channel in five different towns (A, B, C, D and E) along with the number of viewers who subscribed the channel among them in the year 2023. Number of viewers in the town E is 1200. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: For each town, number of channel viewers is the sum of number of viewers who subscribed for the channel and the number of viewers who did not subscribe for the channel.If P is the total number of unsubscribed viewers in Town- B and Town-C together, and Q is the number of unsubscribed viewers in town-E, then Q is _____ % of P.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.60
  • B.70
  • C.80
  • D.75
Correct Answer: 70

Total Viewers = 12000.2 = 6000

P = 400 + 800 = 1200

Q = 840

 

Required percentage = 1200-8401200×100 = 70%

Question 6
The impaired memory for events occuring before the onset of amnesia is called as:-(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Phonological loop
  • B.Retrograde amnesia
  • C.Anterograde amnesia
  • D.Visuospatial sketchpad
Correct Answer: Retrograde amnesia

Retrograde amnesia refers to the loss of memory for events that occurred before the onset of amnesia. A person with retrograde amnesia cannot recall past experiences or information stored before a certain point in time (usually due to brain injury or trauma).

 

In contrast, Anterograde amnesia (Option C) is the inability to form new memories after the onset of amnesia.

 

Phonological loop (Option A) and Visuospatial sketchpad (Option D) are components of working memory used for temporary storage and manipulation of verbal and visual-spatial information, respectively—they are not types of amnesia.

Question 7
What of the following aspects does not pertain to deliberate practice of learners?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.The task is too easy or too hard
  • B.The learner is given informative feedback about his/her performance
  • C.The learner has adequate chances to repeat the task
  • D.The learner has the opportunity to correct his/her errors
Correct Answer: The task is too easy or too hard

Deliberate practice refers to a focused, goal-oriented method of practice designed to improve performance. Key characteristics include:

  • Performing tasks that are challenging but achievable.
  • Receiving informative feedback (Option B).
  • Having ample opportunity for repetition (Option C).
  • Having the chance to correct errors (Option D).

 

If the task is too easy or too hard (Option A), it does not qualify as deliberate practice because:

 

A too easy task does not challenge the learner.

 

A too hard task causes frustration without meaningful progress.

 

Hence, option (A) does not pertain to deliberate practice.

 

Here’s a table comparing Deliberate Practice with Regular (Naive) Practice:

Question 8
Match the List-I with List-IILIST I (Online Softwares/Tools)a. Trellob. Hootsuitec. GitHubClassroomd. FlipgridLIST II (Application)i. Managing and analyzing social media campaignsii. Managing and recording, fun built-in camera recording add effects and share in the groupsiii. Managing group projects and tasksiv. Managing and writing coding assignmentsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a-iv, b-iii, c-ii, d-i
  • B.a-iii, b-iv, c-ii, d-i
  • C.a-iii, b-i, c-iv, d-ii
  • D.a-i, b-ii, c-iii, d-iv
Correct Answer: a-iii, b-i, c-iv, d-ii

The correct answer is option (C), i.e., a-iii, b-i, c-iv, d-ii.

 

Let’s match each tool with its correct application:

 

a. Trello → iii. Managing group projects and tasks

Trello is a popular project management tool that uses boards, lists, and cards to organize tasks and collaborate with team members.

 

b. Hootsuite → i. Managing and analyzing social media campaigns

Hootsuite helps schedule, manage, and analyze posts across multiple social media platforms.

 

c. GitHub Classroom → iv. Managing and writing coding assignments

GitHub Classroom is designed for educators to distribute and review coding assignments using GitHub repositories.

 

d. Flipgrid → ii. Managing and recording, fun built-in camera recording add effects and share in the groups

Flipgrid is a video discussion platform where students can record short videos with filters and stickers for classroom sharing.

Question 9
Which of the following channels of Swayam Prabha are under IGNOU, New Delhi?a. Channel 4b. Channel 7c. Channel 15d. Channel 12e. Channel 20Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a and e only
  • B.c and d only
  • C.b, c and e only
  • D.a, b and d only
Correct Answer: c and d only

Channel 4 is under CEC, New Delhi.

Channel 7 is under CEC, New Delhi.

 

Channel 12 is under IGNOU, New Delhi.

Channel 15 is under IGNOU, New Delhi.

 

Channel 20 is under IIT Bombay.

 

Thus, correct answer is option (B).

Question 10
Which of the following can be used as LMS to create and manage course content?a. Moodleb. Zoomc. Edmodod. Canvase. StrawpollChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.b, d and e only
  • B.a, c and d only
  • C.b, c and e only
  • D.a, b and d only
Correct Answer: a, c and d only

To qualify as a Learning Management System (LMS), a tool must allow creating, managing, and delivering course content. Let’s evaluate each option:

 

a. Moodle – Yes, it's a full-featured open-source LMS used worldwide for course content management.

 

b. Zoom – No, it's a video conferencing tool, not an LMS.

 

c. Edmodo – Yes, it's an LMS designed for K–12 learning, allowing course sharing, communication, and assessment.

 

d. Canvas – Yes, it's a robust cloud-based LMS widely used in schools and universities.

 

e. Strawpoll – No, it's a tool for creating simple online polls, not for managing courses.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 11
According to UGC Regulations 2018 on Plagiarism, which of the following percentage of similarity in the thesis would result in the cancellation of a student's registration in the programme he/she is registered in?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.42%
  • B.53%
  • C.58%
  • D.61%
Correct Answer: 61%

According to the UGC Regulations 2018 on Plagiarism, the following levels of penalties apply:

 

Level 3 (Above 60%): Similarities above 60% result in the cancellation of the student's registration in the program.

Question 12
Which of the following types of sampling is likely to have least bias?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Snowball sampling
  • B.Simple random sampling
  • C.Convenience sampling
  • D.Purposive sampling
Correct Answer: Simple random sampling

Explanation:

 

(A) Snowball sampling: This method involves selecting participants based on referrals from other participants. It is prone to bias because the sample may not be representative of the entire population, as participants often refer others from similar social networks.

 

(B) Simple random sampling: This is a method where every member of the population has an equal chance of being selected. It is likely to have the least bias, as the selection process is random and does not depend on any particular characteristic.

 

(C) Convenience sampling: This involves selecting participants who are easiest to access. It tends to have high bias because the sample may not represent the broader population.

 

(D) Purposive sampling: This method involves selecting participants based on specific characteristics or criteria. While useful in certain research contexts, it can introduce bias because the researcher selects participants with particular traits.

 

Thus, (B) Simple random sampling is the most unbiased method because every individual has an equal chance of being selected.

 

The correct answer is (B) Simple random sampling.

Question 13
Identify the correct statements regarding survey research.a. A closed ended question contains a set of answers that a respondent choosesb. Self-Deception Positivity is a form of social desirability biasc. Impression Management is a form of social desirability biasd. In key informant sampling, a researcher uses a member of the population of interest to actively recruit othersChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, b and c only
  • B.b, c and d only
  • C.a, b and d only
  • D.a, c and d only
Correct Answer: a, b and c only

Let's go through each statement to understand why (A) a, b, and c only is the correct answer:

 

a. A closed-ended question contains a set of answers that a respondent chooses: This is correct. Closed-ended questions provide respondents with a predefined set of answers to choose from (e.g., yes/no, multiple-choice questions).

 

b. Self-Deception Positivity is a form of social desirability bias: This is correct. Self-Deception Positivity occurs when respondents provide answers that they believe reflect favorably on themselves, even if these answers are not entirely truthful. This is a form of social desirability bias.

 

c. Impression Management is a form of social desirability bias: This is correct. Impression Management refers to the behavior of respondents trying to present themselves in a favorable light, which is also a type of social desirability bias.

 

d. In key informant sampling, a researcher uses a member of the population of interest to actively recruit others: This statement is incorrect. In key informant sampling, the researcher selects individuals who have specialized knowledge about the population to gather insights. It is not about actively recruiting others.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (A) a, b, and c only.

Question 14
Arrange the following statistical measures in increasing orderA. 37thpercentileB. first quartileC. medianD. third decileChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, b, c, d
  • B.b, d, a, c
  • C.b, c, a, d
  • D.c, b, d, a
Correct Answer: b, d, a, c

Now, let's arrange the values in increasing order:

Third decile: 30% of the data falls below this value.

First quartile: 25% of the data falls below this value.

37th percentile: This is between the 30th and 50th percentile.

Median (Q2): 50% of the data falls below this value.

The correct answer is (B) b, d, a, c

Question 15
Match List I with List IIList I (n = number of trials, p=probability of success)a. n = 7, p = 0.3b. n = 5, p = 0.4c. n = 8, p = 0.5d. n = 6, p = 0.6List II (Variance of Binomial Distribution)i. 1.44ii. 2.00iii. 1.20iv. 1.47Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a-i, b-ii, c-iii, d-iv
  • B.a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i
  • C.a-iii, b-iv, c-i, d-ii
  • D.a-iv, b-iii, c-ii, d-i
Correct Answer: a-iv, b-iii, c-ii, d-i

So, the correct answer is (A) a-i, b-ii, c-iii, d-iv.

Question 16
In the post-information age, information is highly.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Homogeneous
  • B.Communitarian
  • C.Personalised
  • D.Impersonal
Correct Answer: Personalised

In the post-information age, often linked with the digital or knowledge age, information is:

 

  • Tailored to individual needs and preferences

 

  • Delivered through algorithms (e.g., YouTube, Google, Instagram)

 

  • Driven by big data, AI, and user behavior tracking

 

This leads to personalised content, where people receive information specific to their interests, location, past behavior, and even predicted future needs.

 

Thus, option (C) is correct.

Question 17
In an information society, even nuclear families have the characteristic of technological(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Separation
  • B.Mediation
  • C.Constriction
  • D.Passivity
Correct Answer: Mediation

In an information society, where technology and digital media are deeply embedded in daily life, even nuclear families interact through and are influenced by various forms of technology.

 

Family communication, education, entertainment, and even emotional interactions are often mediated by technology — such as smartphones, televisions, video calls, and social media.

 

This is referred to as technological mediation, where technology acts as an intervening channel between people.

 

Thus, option (B) is the correct answer.

Question 18
A hot medium has the features of:a. Pre-supposition of interactionb. Providing large amounts of informationc. Little effort needed for interpretationd. Less scope for participatione. Immediate feedbackChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, b, c only
  • B.c, d, e only
  • C.a, c, d only
  • D.b, c, d only
Correct Answer: b, c, d only

The concept of "hot" and "cool" media comes from Marshall McLuhan, a media theorist.

 

Hot Media:

  • Provide a lot of information (b)
  • Require little effort for interpretation (c)
  • Allow less scope for audience participation (d)

 

Examples: Radio, movies, printed books: These are high-definition, meaning they are rich in content and engage one sense completely, leaving less room for active engagement.

Question 19
Identify the correct chronological sequence of the following communication devices:a. Blu-ray Discb. Universal media Discc. Digital Compact Discd. Hi 8e. Digital Audio TapeChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.e, d, c, b, a
  • B.d, c, b, a, e
  • C.c, b, a, e, d
  • D.b, a, e, d, c
Correct Answer: e, d, c, b, a

Let’s place each communication/storage device in chronological order of their introduction:

 

e. Digital Audio Tape (DAT) – Introduced in 1987

Used for high-quality audio recording.

 

d. Hi8 – Introduced in 1989

An analog video format used in camcorders.

 

c. Digital Compact Disc (CD) – Commercialized around 1992–1993

Used for storing digital audio and data.

 

b. Universal Media Disc (UMD) – Launched in 2004

Used mainly in Sony PlayStation Portable (PSP) for games and videos.

 

a. Blu-ray Disc – Introduced in 2006

Designed for high-definition video and large data storage.

 

Thus, option (A) is correct.

Question 20
Match the List-I with List-IILIST I (Medium)a. Radiob. Printc. Hot mediumd. InternetLIST II (Characteristic)i. Asynchronousii. High intensity of informationiii. Interactivityiv. Only Acoustic mediumChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a-i, b-ii, c-iii, d-iv
  • B.a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i
  • C.a-iii, b-iv, c-i, d-ii
  • D.a-iv, b-i, c-ii, d-iii
Correct Answer: a-iv, b-i, c-ii, d-iii

Correct Answer is option (D) a-iv, b-i, c-ii, d-iii

 

Let’s match each medium with its correct characteristic:

 

a. Radio → iv. Only Acoustic medium

Radio is an audio-only (acoustic) medium — no visual element.

 

b. Print → i. Asynchronous

Print media like newspapers, books, etc., are asynchronous, meaning the sender and receiver do not interact in real-time.

 

c. Hot medium → ii. High intensity of information

As per Marshall McLuhan, hot media are high-definition, offering abundant information and engaging one sense fully (like print, radio, or film).

 

d. Internet → iii. Interactivity

The internet enables two-way communication, user engagement, and interactive experiences.

Question 21
If a fraction is multiplied by itself and then divided by the reciprocal of the same fraction, the result obtained is49278. Find the fraction.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.332
  • B.131
  • C.232
  • D.431
Correct Answer: 332

Let fraction be x

Then, x21x = 133127

or x = 113 = 332

Question 22
Find the number that can be inserted at the place of questions mark (?) in the series given below.4, 10, 20, 34, 52, 74, ?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.98
  • B.102
  • C.97
  • D.100
Correct Answer: 100

10 − 4 = 6

20 − 10 = 10

34 − 20 = 14

52 − 34 = 18

74 − 52 = 22

 

So, the differences are:

6, 10, 14, 18, 22

We see that the difference increases by +4 each time.

Next number = 74 + 22 + 4 = 100

Match the List-I with List-IILIST I (Statement)a. Average of the squares of first 10 natural numbersb. Average of first 5 multiplies of 5c. Average of first 25 natural numbersd.   • A.a-i, b-ii, c-iii, d-iv
  • B.a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i
  • C.a-iv, b-i, c-ii, d-iii
  • D.a-iii, b-iv, c-i, d-ii
Correct Answer: a-iii, b-iv, c-i, d-ii

The correct answer is D

Question 24
In a certain code language:"Kasluniri Cuisines are good" is coded as: " KI CI FI GI""You like Kashmiri Cuisines" is coded as: "AI LI KI CI""Indians like Punjabi Cuisines" is coded as: "MI LI BI CI""Punjabi Cuisines are best" is coded as: "BI CI FI TI"How the words 'you', 'Indians' and' best' are coded in this language.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.LI, KI and AI
  • B.KI, MI and CI
  • C.AI, MI and TI
  • D.AI, MI and CI
Correct Answer: AI, MI and TI

You = AI

Indians = MI

Best = TI

Question 25
There are some Cows and Ducks in a park. The total number of heads of Cows and Ducks together is 60. However, the total number legs of the cows and ducks together is 180. Find the number of cows and ducks in the park, respectively.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.30, 30
  • B.32, 28
  • C.28, 32
  • D.24, 36
Correct Answer: 30, 30

4 C + 2 D = 180

Also, C + D = 60

Solving, we get C = 30 and D = 20

Question 26
"If we allow students to retake exams for better grades, next they'll want to retake entire courses, and soon they’ll expect to graduate without completing any coursework. This will lead to the complete collapse of the education system." Which fallacy is committed in the above argument?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Hasty Generalization
  • B.Slippery Slope
  • C.False Dichotomy
  • D.Ad Hominem
Correct Answer: Slippery Slope

The argument assumes that allowing a small action (retaking exams) will inevitably lead to extreme consequences (graduating without completing coursework), without providing any logical reasoning for the progression. This is the classic structure of the Slippery Slope fallacy, where one event is assumed to trigger a chain of undesirable events, leading to an exaggerated and unrealistic outcome.

Question 27
Which of the following statements are true?a. A valid argument may have false premises and a true conclusionb. An invalid argument may have false premises and a true conclusionc. An invalid argument may have true premises and a false conclusiond. A valid argument may have true premises and a false conclusionChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, b, c, d
  • B.b and c only
  • C.a and d only
  • D.a, b and c only
Correct Answer: a, b and c only

The correct answer is (D) a, b and c only

Explanation:

Let's analyze the options:

a. A valid argument may have false premises and a true conclusion: This is true. A valid argument is one where the conclusion follows logically from the premises, but the premises don’t necessarily have to be true. So, even if the premises are false, the argument can still be valid if the conclusion logically follows from those premises.

b. An invalid argument may have false premises and a true conclusion: This is true. An invalid argument does not guarantee that the conclusion follows logically from the premises, but the conclusion could still happen to be true regardless of the premises.

c. An invalid argument may have true premises and a false conclusion: This is true. In an invalid argument, the premises do not guarantee the truth of the conclusion, so it’s possible to have true premises and a false conclusion.

d. A valid argument may have true premises and a false conclusion: This is false. A valid argument means that if the premises are true, the conclusion must also be true. Therefore, a valid argument cannot have true premises and a false conclusion.

Thus, the correct answer is (D) a, b and c only.

Question 28
Arrange the following in order of decreasing denotation.a. Physicsb. Natural Sciencesc. Sciencesd. Nuclear PhysicsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.c, b, a, d
  • B.b, c, a, d
  • C.d, a, b, c
  • D.b, c, d, a
Correct Answer: c, b, a, d

Denotation refers to the number of things a term applies to, with broader categories having greater denotation. Let’s break it down:

Sciences – the most general term; refers to the entire field of scientific study (including physics, biology, chemistry, and more).

Natural Sciences – a subset of sciences, which specifically refers to the study of natural phenomena (like physics, biology, etc.).

Physics – a more specific branch of natural sciences.

Nuclear Physics – the most specific term, referring to a subfield of physics focused on atomic and subatomic particles.

Thus, the correct order of decreasing denotation (from most general to most specific) is:
Sciences > Natural Sciences > Physics > Nuclear Physics

This corresponds with option (A).

Question 29
Match the List-I with List-IILIST I (Type of informal Fallacy)a. False causeb. Appeal to Emotionc. Complex Questiond. Fallacy of CompositionLIST II (Reason)i. Relevanceii. Ambiguityiii. Defective Inductioniv. PresumptionChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a-iv, b-ii, c-iii, d-i
  • B.a-iii, b-i, c-iv, d-ii
  • C.a-iii, b-iv, c-i, d-ii
  • D.a-ii, b-i, c-iv, d-iii
Correct Answer: a-iii, b-i, c-iv, d-ii

The correct answer is (B) a-iii, b-i, c-iv, d-ii.

Explanation:

Let's break down each fallacy and match it with the correct reason:

a. False cause: This is a defective induction fallacy. It occurs when one incorrectly assumes that because two events are correlated, one must be the cause of the other. Therefore, the reason is iii. Defective Induction.

b. Appeal to Emotion: This is a relevance fallacy. It occurs when someone tries to win an argument by appealing to the emotions of the audience, rather than providing logical evidence. Therefore, the reason is i. Relevance.

c. Complex Question: This fallacy occurs when a question is asked in such a way that it presumes something to be true without providing evidence, leading the person being asked to implicitly accept that assumption. It’s an example of presumption. Therefore, the reason is iv. Presumption.

d. Fallacy of Composition: This fallacy happens when someone assumes that what is true of the parts is true of the whole. It’s a fallacy of ambiguity, as the meaning or relationship between parts and the whole is misinterpreted. Therefore, the reason is ii. Ambiguity.

Thus, the answer is (B) a-iii, b-i, c-iv, d-ii.

Question 30
According to Nya-ya logic which of the following statements is fallacious because the middle term instead of proving the existence of the major term in the minor term, it proves its non-existence therein.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Sound is eternal because it is produced
  • B.The hill has fire because it is knowable
  • C.Sound is eternal because it is audible
  • D.All things are non-eternal because they are knowable
Correct Answer: Sound is eternal because it is produced

Given is the case of "Viruddha" fallacy.

 

Viruddha is the contradictory middle. The middle term, instead of being pervaded by the presence of the major term, is pervaded by the absence of the major term. Instead of proving the existence of the major term in the minor term, it proves its non-existence therein; e.g., 'sound is eternal, because it is produced'. Here ‘produced, instead of proving the eternality of sound, proves its non-eternality. Here the middle term itself disproves the original proposition and proves its contradictory.

Question 31
A keylogger, short for keystroke logger, is a type of _____ that monitors and records what you type on your computer or mobile phone.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Worm
  • B.Spyware
  • C.Virus
  • D.Trojan Horse
Correct Answer: Spyware

The correct answer is (B) Spyware.

 

A keylogger is a type of spyware that records the keystrokes you make on your computer or mobile device, often without your knowledge. This information can be used for malicious purposes, such as stealing passwords or sensitive information.

Question 32
Which of the following pair of acronym and its expansion is incorrectly matched?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.XML- Extensible Markup Language
  • B.WWW- World Wide Web
  • C.VLSI- Very Large-Scale Integration
  • D.SMS- Short Message Software
Correct Answer: SMS- Short Message Software

The correct answer is (D) SMS - Short Message Software.

 

SMS stands for Short Message Service, not Short Message Software. It refers to the service that allows the sending of short text messages between mobile devices.

Question 33
Identify the sequence of ICT terms A-D that correctly fills the blanks in the following paragraph:________ is permanent memory that is used to store instructions that are needed to start the computer. _____ is fast temporary memory that is used to store data and applications that are currently in use. _____ carries out processing and turns data into information. The _____ is used to plug all other components into the computer system.a. Motherboardb. RAMc. CPUd. ROMChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.d, b, a, c
  • B.a, d, c, b
  • C.c, a, b, d
  • D.d, b, c, a
Correct Answer: d, b, c, a

The correct answer is (D) d, b, c, a.

 

d (ROM) is permanent memory that stores instructions needed to start the computer (e.g., BIOS).

 

b (RAM) is fast temporary memory used to store data and applications currently in use.

 

c (CPU) is the main circuit board to which all components are connected.

 

a (Motherboard) carries out processing and turns data into information.

Question 34
Which of the following software titles are examples of operating system?a. MS-Wordb. Linuxc. MS-PowerPointd. Adobe Photoshope. AndroidChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, c and d only
  • B.a, b, c and d only
  • C.b and e only
  • D.b, d and e only
Correct Answer: b and e only

The correct answer is (C) b and e only.

 

Linux and Android are both operating systems.

 

MS-Word, MS-PowerPoint, and Adobe Photoshop are application software, not operating systems.

Question 35
Match the List-I with List-IILIST I (Computer Network)a. Flat Networkb. Extranetc. Intranetd. InternetLIST II (Description)i. Describes today's worldwide connection of networksii. Describes a network that lies completely inside a trusted area of a network and is under the security control of system and network administratorsiii. Describes a network that avoids packet-looping issues, through an architecture that does not have layersiv. It describes a network that is an extension of a selected portion of a company's Intranet to external partnersChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a-iv, b-iii, c-i, d-ii
  • B.a-iii, b-iv, c-ii, d-i
  • C.a-ii, b-i, c-iii, d-iv
  • D.a-iii, b-iv, c-i, d-ii
Correct Answer: a-iii, b-iv, c-ii, d-i

The correct answer is (B) a-iii, b-iv, c-ii, d-i.

 

a. Flat Network: Describes a network that avoids packet-looping issues, through an architecture that does not have layers. (Answer: iii)

 

b. Extranet: Describes a network that is an extension of a selected portion of a company's Intranet to external partners. (Answer: iv)

 

c. Intranet: Describes a network that lies completely inside a trusted area of a network and is under the security control of system and network administrators. (Answer: ii)

 

d. Internet: Describes today's worldwide connection of networks. (Answer: i)

Question 36
Which one of the following is known as the heart of sewage treatment?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Primary treatment
  • B.Secondary treatment
  • C.Tertiary treatment
  • D.Advanced treatment
Correct Answer: Secondary treatment

The correct answer is (B) Secondary treatment.

 

Secondary treatment is considered the "heart" of sewage treatment. This stage involves biological processes where microorganisms break down the organic matter present in sewage. It is highly effective at removing dissolved and suspended biological matter, making it a crucial step in the wastewater treatment process.

Question 37
Which of the following are true about class I and class II ozone depleting substances?a. Ozone depleting potential of class-I substances are far more than class IIb. Ozone depleting potential of class II substances are far more than class Ic. All Chlorofluoro carbons belong to class II ozone depleting substancesd. HCFC-21 belongs to class II ozone depleting substancee. Class-I contains fully halogenated gasesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, d and e only
  • B.b, c and e only
  • C.a, c and d only
  • D.c, d and e only
Correct Answer: a, d and e only

The correct answer is (A) a, d and e only.

 

a. Class I substances (like CFCs) have a much higher ozone-depleting potential than Class II substances (like HCFCs).

 

d. HCFC-21 is indeed a Class II ozone-depleting substance, as HCFCs are less harmful to the ozone layer than CFCs but still contribute to depletion.

 

e. Class I substances are typically fully halogenated gases (e.g., CFCs), which are highly effective at destroying ozone molecules.

Question 38
What is the correct sequence of following drinking water treatment processes from initial to final?A. FiltrationB. DisinfectionC. Gravity settlement of large particlesD. FlocculationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.A, B, D, C
  • C.C, D, A, B
  • D.C, D, B, A
Correct Answer: C, D, A, B

The correct sequence of drinking water treatment processes from initial to final is (C) C, D, A, B.

 

Gravity settlement of large particles (C): This is the first step where larger particles, such as sand or silt, are allowed to settle out of the water due to gravity.

 

Flocculation (D): In this step, chemicals are added to the water to bind small particles into larger clumps (flocs), which can then be removed more easily.

 

Filtration (A): After flocculation, the water is passed through filters (often sand or other materials) to remove the remaining smaller particles.

 

Disinfection (B): The final step involves disinfecting the water, typically by adding chlorine or other disinfectants, to kill any remaining pathogens.

Question 39
Doha Amendment is an amendment to.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Montreal Protocol
  • B.Kyoto Protocol
  • C.Stockholm Convention
  • D.Rio Summit
Correct Answer: Kyoto Protocol

The correct answer is option (B) - Kyoto Protocol.

 

The Doha Amendment to the Kyoto Protocol was adopted in 2012 and extended the protocol's commitment period for a second phase (2013-2020). It introduced new commitments for reducing greenhouse gas emissions among developed countries.

Question 40
Match the List-I with List-IILIST I (Sustainable Development Goal (SDG)A. Climate actionB. Life on LandC. Responsible consumption and productionD. Life below waterLIST II (SDG No)I. SDG 12II. SDG 13III. SDG 14IV. SDG 15Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-I, B-III, C-II, D-IV
  • B.A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II
  • C.A-II, B-IV, CIII, D-I
  • D.A-II, B-IV, C-I, D-III
Correct Answer: A-II, B-IV, C-I, D-III

The correct answer is option (D) - A-II, B-IV, C-I, D-III.

 

A. Climate Action → SDG 13

 

B. Life on Land → SDG 15

 

C. Responsible Consumption and Production → SDG 12

 

D. Life Below Water → SDG 14

Question 41
The New Education Policy, 2020 envisages making all learners:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Social volunteers
  • B.Efficient administrators
  • C.True global citizens
  • D.Spiritual persons
Correct Answer: True global citizens

The correct answer is option (C) - True global citizens.

 

The New Education Policy (NEP) 2020 aims to transform the education system to nurture individuals who are rooted in Indian culture and values, while also being prepared to participate meaningfully in the global community. It promotes 21st-century skills, critical thinking, multilingualism, and ethics, all contributing to the vision of creating "true global citizens."

Question 42
The Kanya Mahavidyalaya, an Arya Sainaji School, was established in 1896 by:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Bhai Veer Singh
  • B.Agya Kaur
  • C.Bhai Takht Singh
  • D.Lala Devraj
Correct Answer: Lala Devraj

Founded in 1886 by Lala Dev Raj Ji, the crusader of women education, it is an institution which was started as a result of the renaissance that India witnessed towards the end of the 19th century.

Question 43
The major recommendations of the Radhakrishnan Commission are:a. Transfer of urban universities to rural areasb. Setting up of rural universitiesc. Development of research in agriculture, commerce, law, science and technologyd. Making English language as the medium of instruction at all levels of teachinge. Focus on student's WelfareChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, b only
  • B.b, c, d only
  • C.c, d, e only
  • D.b, c, e only
Correct Answer: b, c, e only

The correct answer is option (D) - b, c, e only.

 

The Radhakrishnan Commission (University Education Commission, 1948–49) made several key recommendations for reforming higher education in India:

 

b. Setting up of rural universities – Yes, to bring education closer to rural communities.

 

c. Development of research in agriculture, commerce, law, science and technology – Yes, to modernize and expand India's knowledge base.

 

e. Focus on student welfare – Yes, including mental health, extracurricular activities, and proper facilities.

Question 44
Arrange the following Ancient Texts in chronological order.A. Rig VedaB. Lila-vatiC.A-ryabhatiyaD. Arthas-astraChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, c, d, b
  • B.a, d, c, b
  • C.b, c, d, a
  • D.a, b, d, c
Correct Answer: a, d, c, b

The correct answer is option (B) - a, d, c, b.

Question 45
Match the List-I with List-IILIST I (Authors)a. Pingalb. Pa-ninic.A-ryabhattad. Bha-skara-charyaLIST II (Works)i. Lila-vatiii. Chhandasa-straiii. Asta-dhya-yiiv.A-ryabhatiyaChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a-ii, b-iv, c-iii, d-i
  • B.a-iii, b-ii, c-iv, d-i
  • C.a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i
  • D.a-i, b-iii, c-iv, d-ii
Correct Answer: a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i

The correct answer is option (C) - a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i.

 

a. Pingal – ii. Chhandasāstra

Pingala authored the Chhandaśāstra, an ancient treatise on Sanskrit prosody (meter).

 

b. Pāṇini – iii. Aṣṭādhyāyī

Pāṇini wrote the Aṣṭādhyāyī, a foundational work in Sanskrit grammar.

 

c. Āryabhaṭṭa – iv. Āryabhaṭīya

Āryabhaṭṭa authored Āryabhaṭīya, a seminal text in Indian astronomy and mathematics.

 

d. Bhāskarāchārya – i. Līlāvatī

Bhāskara II wrote Līlāvatī, a famous mathematical text.

Question 46
Read the passage carefully and answer the questions that follows:A famine in China from 1958 to 1960 estimated to have killed about twenty-five million people. The reason why that's called a political crime-an ideological crime-which was discussed in most detail by Amartya Sen; it's part of the work for which he won the Nobel Prize. Sen is an economist who treated this as an ideological crime for food reasons. He said it wasn't a matter of intent; they didn't intend to kill anybody. It's just that the ideological instructions were such that it happened. It was a totalitarian state where no information about what was happening ever got back to the center. They couldn't take any action because that's what happens in a totalitarian state. So it was a reflection of the totalitarian instructions, a huge massacre that wasn't intended. They didn't intend to kill twenty-five million people, but it was still a major massacre, and it's correct to call it one of the major atrocities of the twentieth century, and the worst single component of the crimes of Communism.What period did the famine in China, described in the passage, occur?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.1945 to 1948
  • B.1958 to 1960
  • C.1965 to 1968
  • D.1972 to 1975
Correct Answer: 1958 to 1960

The passage clearly states:

 

"A famine in China from 1958 to 1960 estimated to have killed about twenty-five million people..."

Therefore, option (B) is correct.

 

This timeframe is directly mentioned, making it the correct answer.

Question 47
Read the passage carefully and answer the questions that follows:A famine in China from 1958 to 1960 estimated to have killed about twenty-five million people. The reason why that's called a political crime-an ideological crime-which was discussed in most detail by Amartya Sen; it's part of the work for which he won the Nobel Prize. Sen is an economist who treated this as an ideological crime for food reasons. He said it wasn't a matter of intent; they didn't intend to kill anybody. It's just that the ideological instructions were such that it happened. It was a totalitarian state where no information about what was happening ever got back to the center. They couldn't take any action because that's what happens in a totalitarian state. So it was a reflection of the totalitarian instructions, a huge massacre that wasn't intended. They didn't intend to kill twenty-five million people, but it was still a major massacre, and it's correct to call it one of the major atrocities of the twentieth century, and the worst single component of the crimes of Communism.According to the passage, how many people are estimated to have died in the famine in China?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.15 million
  • B.25 million
  • C.35 million
  • D.45 million
Correct Answer: 25 million

The passage clearly states:

 

"A famine in China from 1958 to 1960 estimated to have killed about twenty-five million people."

 

This directly supports Option (B) as the correct answer.

Question 48
Read the passage carefully and answer the questions that follows:A famine in China from 1958 to 1960 estimated to have killed about twenty-five million people. The reason why that's called a political crime-an ideological crime-which was discussed in most detail by Amartya Sen; it's part of the work for which he won the Nobel Prize. Sen is an economist who treated this as an ideological crime for food reasons. He said it wasn't a matter of intent; they didn't intend to kill anybody. It's just that the ideological instructions were such that it happened. It was a totalitarian state where no information about what was happening ever got back to the center. They couldn't take any action because that's what happens in a totalitarian state. So it was a reflection of the totalitarian instructions, a huge massacre that wasn't intended. They didn't intend to kill twenty-five million people, but it was still a major massacre, and it's correct to call it one of the major atrocities of the twentieth century, and the worst single component of the crimes of Communism.Who discussed the famine in detail and considered it an ideological crime?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Karl Marx
  • B.Amartya Sen
  • C.Noam Chomsky
  • D.T. S Eliot

"...an ideological crime—which was discussed in most detail by Amartya Sen; it's part of the work for which he won the Nobel Prize."
