Question 49
Read the passage carefully and answer the questions that follows:A famine in China from 1958 to 1960 estimated to have killed about twenty-five million people. The reason why that's called a political crime-an ideological crime-which was discussed in most detail by Amartya Sen; it's part of the work for which he won the Nobel Prize. Sen is an economist who treated this as an ideological crime for food reasons. He said it wasn't a matter of intent; they didn't intend to kill anybody. It's just that the ideological instructions were such that it happened. It was a totalitarian state where no information about what was happening ever got back to the center. They couldn't take any action because that's what happens in a totalitarian state. So it was a reflection of the totalitarian instructions, a huge massacre that wasn't intended. They didn't intend to kill twenty-five million people, but it was still a major massacre, and it's correct to call it one of the major atrocities of the twentieth century, and the worst single component of the crimes of Communism.According to the passage, what was the main reason for which the famine occurred in the totalitarian state?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Intentional government polices
  • B.Unpredictable natural disasters
  • C.Foreign interventions
  • D.Lack of information reaching the central authorities
Correct Answer: Lack of information reaching the central authorities

The passage clearly attributes the cause of the famine to systemic issues in a totalitarian state, specifically:

 

"...no information about what was happening ever got back to the center. They couldn't take any action because that's what happens in a totalitarian state."

 

Thus, option (D) is correct.

Question 50
Read the passage carefully and answer the questions that follows:A famine in China from 1958 to 1960 estimated to have killed about twenty-five million people. The reason why that's called a political crime-an ideological crime-which was discussed in most detail by Amartya Sen; it's part of the work for which he won the Nobel Prize. Sen is an economist who treated this as an ideological crime for food reasons. He said it wasn't a matter of intent; they didn't intend to kill anybody. It's just that the ideological instructions were such that it happened. It was a totalitarian state where no information about what was happening ever got back to the center. They couldn't take any action because that's what happens in a totalitarian state. So it was a reflection of the totalitarian instructions, a huge massacre that wasn't intended. They didn't intend to kill twenty-five million people, but it was still a major massacre, and it's correct to call it one of the major atrocities of the twentieth century, and the worst single component of the crimes of Communism.How does the passage classify the famine in terms of twentieth-century atrocities?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A deliberate genocide
  • B.A minor event
  • C.An unavoidable disaster
  • D.One of the major atrocities
Correct Answer: One of the major atrocities

The passage clearly states:

 

"...it was still a major massacre, and it's correct to call it one of the major atrocities of the twentieth century..."

 

This directly supports Option (D).

Quiz Attempt #119711

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following tables shows the number of employees working in six different Offices (A–F) of an IT Company during the years from 2018 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:In the year 2020, the number of employee working in office-C is approximately ____________% less than the total number of employees working in all the six offices together.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.81
  • B.86
  • C.28
  • D.83
Correct Answer: 83

Total number of employees in 2020 = 272 + 192 + 264 + 248 + 316 + 280 = 1572

Difference = 1572 – 264 = 1308

 

Percentage less = 13081572×100 ≈ 83%

Question 2
The following tables shows the number of employees working in six different Offices (A–F) of an IT Company during the years from 2018 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:For all the six given years, the difference between the average number of employees working in office-D and office-E is(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.74
  • B.66
  • C.72
  • D.70
Correct Answer: 74

Required difference = 1920-14766 = 74

Question 3
The following tables shows the number of employees working in six different Offices (A–F) of an IT Company during the years from 2018 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:In office-F, the percentage increase in the number of employees in comparison to previous year is more than 6% for exactly -----------year(s)(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.1
  • B.2
  • C.3
  • D.4
Correct Answer: 2

In 2020 Increase = 280-264264×100 = 6.06%

In 2022 Increase = 292-252252×100 = 15.87%

In 2023 Increase = 300-292291×100 = 2.74%

For rest of the years there is a decrease.

Thus, the percentage increase in the number of employees in comparison to previous year is more than 6% for exactly 2 years.

Question 4
The following tables shows the number of employees working in six different Offices (A–F) of an IT Company during the years from 2018 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:For all the six given years, what is the ratio of total number of employees working in Office-A to that in office-B?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.2:1
  • B.41:26
  • C.19:11
  • D.11:19
Correct Answer: 41:26

Required ratio = 18041144 = 41 : 26

Question 5
The following tables shows the number of employees working in six different Offices (A–F) of an IT Company during the years from 2018 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:In the years 2018 and 2019, the ratio between the number of employees working in all the six offices together is(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.13:11
  • B.13:14
  • C.37:36
  • D.4:3
Correct Answer: 37:36

Total (2018) = 290 + 176 + 222 + 240 + 280 + 272 = 1480

Total (2019) = 256 + 152 + 240 + 224 + 304 + 264 = 1440

Ratio = 14801440 = 37 : 36

Question 6
Arrange the phases of Inquiry-based learning approach in a sequence from Phase I to Phase VA. DiscussionB. OrientationC. ConceptualizationD. ConclusionE. InvestigationChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C, D, E
  • B.E, A, D, B, C
  • C.B, C, E, D, A
  • D.B, E, A, C, D
Correct Answer: B, C, E, D, A

The correct answer is option (C).

 

The Inquiry-Based Learning (IBL) approach involves students actively engaging with a question, problem, or scenario through structured phases. The standard sequence generally includes the following five phases:

 

1. Orientation: Introduces learners to the topic or problem and builds interest.

 

2. Conceptualization: Students generate questions or hypotheses and begin forming ideas.

 

3. Investigation: Active exploration, data collection, experiments, or research to test the hypotheses or answer the questions.

 

4. Conclusion: Students interpret their findings and draw conclusions.

 

5. Discussion: Final reflection, communication of results, and connecting findings to broader contexts or future learning.

Question 7
In self-directed learning which of the following are the key features of self-directed students?A. They have Intrinsic motivation.B. They have the capacity to choose personal goals.C. They have self-discipline.D. They have self-assessment ability.E. They have metacognitive skills.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and D only
  • B.B and E only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A, B, C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D and E

In Self-Directed Learning (SDL), learners take initiative, with or without the help of others, in diagnosing their learning needs, formulating goals, identifying resources, choosing and implementing strategies, and evaluating outcomes. Hence, self-directed students demonstrate the following key features:

 

A. Intrinsic Motivation

They are driven by internal goals and curiosity rather than external rewards.

 

B. Capacity to Choose Personal Goals

They can set and pursue individual learning goals.

 

C. Self-Discipline

They manage their time and efforts effectively without constant supervision.

 

D. Self-Assessment Ability

They regularly reflect and evaluate their own progress and performance.

 

E. Metacognitive Skills

They plan, monitor, and regulate their own learning processes.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 8
The motivated forgetting of traumatic or other very threatening events is known as-(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Repression
  • B.Proactive interference
  • C.Retroactive interference
  • D.Consolidation
Correct Answer: Repression

Repression is a defense mechanism proposed by Sigmund Freud, where the mind unconsciously blocks out painful, traumatic, or threatening memories to protect the individual from psychological distress.

 

The other options do not fit this definition:

 

(B) Proactive interference – When old memories interfere with the recall of new information.

 

(C) Retroactive interference – When new information interferes with the recall of old memories.

 

(D) Consolidation – The process of stabilizing information in long-term memory, not forgetting.

Question 9
Match the List-I with List-IIList I (Swayamprabha Channel Number)A. Channel 10B. Channel 11C. Channel 12D. Channel 13List II (Theme)I. Professional EducationII. Basic and Applied sciencesIII. Social Sciences and HumanitiesIV. Applied SciencesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-III, B-II, C-IV, D-I
  • B.A-IV, B-III, C-II, D-I
  • C.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • D.A-II, B-IV, C-III, D-I
Correct Answer: A-IV, B-III, C-II, D-I

The correct match is as follows:

List I – List II

A. Channel 10 – Applied Sciences

B. Channel 11 – Social Sciences and Humanities

C. Channel 12 – Basic and Applied Sciences

D. Channel 13 – Professional Education

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 10
Which of the following tools would be most effective for a teacher wanting to poll students in real-time during an online lecture?A. Poll everywhereB. LabsterC. StrawpollD. MentimeterE. Survey monkeyChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.B, C and E only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.A, C, D and E only
  • D.C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, C, D and E only

The question asks for tools that allow a teacher to poll students in real-time during an online lecture. Let's evaluate each tool:

 

A. Poll Everywhere

Designed specifically for real-time polling during live sessions — integrates with slides and video calls.

 

B. Labster

A virtual science lab simulation platform, not used for polling.

 

C. Strawpoll

Simple and quick polling tool for instant feedback — usable during live classes.

 

D. Mentimeter

An interactive presentation tool that allows live polling, quizzes, and Q&A sessions.

 

E. SurveyMonkey

Though more commonly used for surveys, it can still be used for quick feedback, though not as real-time-friendly as the others.

Question 11
According to UGC regulations 2018 on plagiarism, which of the following percentage of similarity in the thesis would require a student to submit a revised thesis within six months?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.9%
  • B.13%
  • C.42%
  • D.47%
Correct Answer: 13%

As per the UGC regulations 2018 on plagiarism:

 

Level 1: Similarities above 10% to 40% will result in the student being asked to submit a revised thesis within 6 months.

 

To generalize the results of a study to a different population, the measurements need to demonstrate external validity. External validity refers to the extent to which the findings of a study can be generalized to, or have relevance for, settings, people, times, and measures beyond the study sample. External Validity ensures that the results of a study can be applied to different populations, settings, or times.

Thus, the correct answer is (A) External Validity.

Question 12
A researcher conducts a study on a population and obtains some results. He now wants to generalize these results to a different population. For this, his measurements should show(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.External Validity
  • B.Internal Validity
  • C.Convergent Validity
  • D.Divergent Validity
Correct Answer: External Validity

The correct answer is (A) External Validity.

 

External Validity refers to the extent to which the results of a study can be generalized to other populations, settings, or times. In this case, the researcher wants to generalize the results obtained from one population to another, which requires the study to have high external validity.

Internal Validity (option B) refers to the degree to which the study accurately reflects the cause-and-effect relationship, without interference from other variables.

Convergent Validity (option C) refers to the degree to which two measures of the same construct are correlated, while Divergent Validity (option D) refers to the extent to which a measure does not correlate with unrelated constructs.

 

Thus, the correct choice for generalizing the results to a different population is (A) External Validity.

Question 13
Identify the correct statements regarding web-based study of human subjects:(A) It requires considerably more time per person than laboratory-based study.(B) Data collection occurs at the convenience of the participant.(C) Data collection is automatic.(D) It can be conducted on participants who would have been out of reach of the researcher in physical mode.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.(A), (B), and (C) only
  • B.(B), (C), and (D) only
  • C.(A), (C), and (D) only
  • D.(A), (B), and (D) only
Correct Answer: (B), (C), and (D) only

Web-based studies offer several advantages over traditional laboratory-based studies, and the correct statements are as follows:

(A) It requires considerably more time per person than laboratory-based study: This is generally not true. Web-based studies often save time as participants can take part in them at their convenience, leading to more efficient data collection.

(B) Data collection occurs at the convenience of the participant: This is true. Web-based studies allow participants to complete the study whenever they are available, making it flexible and convenient for them.

(C) Data collection is automatic: This is true. In web-based studies, data collection can be automated, meaning the system can record responses without the need for manual intervention from the researcher.

(D) It can be conducted on participants who would have been out of reach of the researcher in physical mode: This is true. Web-based studies allow researchers to reach a much wider and more diverse group of participants, including those in remote locations or those who are difficult to reach for in-person studies.

 

Thus, the most appropriate answer is (B) (B), (C), and (D) only.

Question 14
Arrange the correlation coefficients computed from the following information on covariance i.e. cov(x,y) and standard deviation σx and σy in increasing order.(A) cov(x,y) = 18, σx= 4,σy= 9(B) cov(x,y) = 15, σx= 8, σy= 3(C) cov(x,y) = 16, σx= 7, σy= 4(D) cov(x,y) = 21, σx= 6, σy= 5Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, C, B, D
  • B.B, C, D, A
  • C.C, B, A, D
  • D.D, B, A, C
Correct Answer: A, C, B, D

Question 15
Match the List–I with List–II:List – I (Scale of measurement)A. NominalB. OrdinalC. IntervalD. RatioList – II (Example of variable)(I) Weight of students(II) Ethnicity(III) Degree of annoyance(IV) Date of birthChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
  • C.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)

Let’s break down the scale of measurement and match it with the examples of variables provided:

 

A. Nominal: This scale involves categorical variables where the categories do not have a meaningful order or ranking. Ethnicity is an example of a nominal variable because it categorizes people without any order. Matches with (II) Ethnicity.

B. Ordinal: This scale involves categories with a meaningful order, but the distances between categories are not equal. Degree of annoyance can be ranked (e.g., not annoyed, mildly annoyed, very annoyed), but the differences between the categories may not be consistent. Matches with (III) Degree of annoyance.

C. Interval: This scale involves ordered categories with equal distances between them, but lacks a true zero point. Date of birth is an example of an interval variable because the dates have equal intervals, but the “zero” point (the beginning of time) is arbitrary. Matches with (IV) Date of birth.

D. Ratio: This scale has all the properties of the interval scale but also includes a meaningful zero point. Weight of students is an example of a ratio variable because weight has a true zero (absence of weight) and the differences are meaningful. Matches with (I) Weight of students.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (B) A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I).

Question 16
Access to information through the invention of print was responsible for the emergence of(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Mediated class distinction
  • B.Media monopoly
  • C.Mass media
  • D.Electronic device of interpersonal communication
Correct Answer: Mass media

The invention of the printing press (by Gutenberg in the 15th century) revolutionized access to information by making books and printed material available to the general public, not just elites or religious authorities. This led to:

  • mass production of information
  • wider literacy and education
  • public discourse and awareness on a large scale

 

This marked the beginning of mass media, where information could be disseminated to large, diverse audiences simultaneously

Question 17
The development of vitascope led to:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.The silent film era
  • B.Video advertisements
  • C.The television network system
  • D.The arrival of computers
Correct Answer: The silent film era

The Vitascope was an early film projector developed by Thomas Edison and Thomas Armat, and it was first publicly demonstrated in 1896.

 

It marked a major breakthrough in projecting moving images to a large audience, laying the foundation for the motion picture industry.

 

This invention led to the rise of the silent film era, where films were produced and shown without synchronized sound, often accompanied by live music.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 18
The internet portals function like(A) Folk entertainers(B) Mass circulation magazines(C) T.V. networks(D) Sites of meta-aggregate contents(E) The home page of usersChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.(A), (B), (C) only
  • B.(A), (B), (C), (D) only
  • C.(A), (C), (D) only
  • D.(B), (C), (D), (E) only
Correct Answer: (B), (C), (D), (E) only

Internet portals (like Yahoo, MSN, or even Google News) act as gateways to a wide range of content and services. Here's how the options relate:

 

(B) Mass circulation magazines

Portals offer a variety of content categories (news, entertainment, sports), similar to general-interest magazines.

 

(C) TV networks

Like TV networks, they provide diverse content and act as distributors for various information channels.

 

(D) Sites of meta-aggregate contents

Portals aggregate content from multiple sources, organizing it for easy user access — classic meta-aggregation.

 

(E) The home page of users

Many users set portals as their default homepages for quick access to email, news, weather, etc.

 

(A) Folk entertainers

Not applicable — portals are digital content platforms, not entertainers rooted in cultural tradition.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 19
The chronological sequence of the space-biased media of communication, as identified as Harold Innis:(A) Radio(B) Television(C) Papyrus(D) Paper(E) NewspaperChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.(A), (C), (D), (E), (B)
  • B.(C), (D), (E), (A), (B)
  • C.(D), (E), (B), (A), (C)
  • D.(E), (B), (A), (D), (C)
Correct Answer: (C), (D), (E), (A), (B)

Harold Innis, a communication theorist, distinguished between:

  • Time-biased media (durable, long-lasting like stone, clay) and
  • Space-biased media (lightweight, portable, designed for wide distribution over distance).

 

Here, we are focusing on space-biased media, which tend to support expansion of empires and widespread communication across territories.

 

Let's arrange the given media chronologically:

 

(C) Papyrus – Used in ancient Egypt; lightweight and transportable (space-biased).

 

(D) Paper – Invented in China and later spread globally; more durable and accessible.

 

(E) Newspaper – Emerged in the 17th century as mass-printed communication.

 

(A) Radio – Early 20th century mass broadcast medium.

 

(B) Television – Came after radio, gaining popularity mid-20th century.

Question 20
Match the List–I with List–II:List – I (Concept)(A) Frames(B) Fandom(C) False consciousness(D) GenreList – II (Meaning)(I) Organized sub-culture(II) The belief that people are duped into blindly accepting the prevailing ideology(III) A class of messages that share distinct characteristics(IV) Social constructsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.(A)-(I), (B)-(II), (C)-(III), (D)-(IV)
  • B.(A)-(II), (B)-(III), (C)-(IV), (D)-(I)
  • C.(A)-(III), (B)-(IV), (C)-(I), (D)-(II)
  • D.(A)-(IV), (B)-(I), (C)-(II), (D)-(III)
Correct Answer: (A)-(IV), (B)-(I), (C)-(II), (D)-(III)

Let's match each concept with its correct meaning:

 

(A) Frames → (IV) Social constructs

In media and communication, frames refer to structures of meaning used to present and interpret events — they are socially constructed lenses that shape how we see the world.

 

(B) Fandom → (I) Organized sub-culture

Fandoms are communities of passionate fans, often forming organized sub-cultures with shared practices, language, and creative outputs.

 

(C) False consciousness → (II) The belief that people are duped into blindly accepting the prevailing ideology

A concept from Marxist theory, false consciousness describes how people may uncritically accept dominant social norms or economic systems that go against their own interests.

 

(D) Genre → (III) A class of messages that share distinct characteristics

Genres are categories of media content (e.g., horror, comedy, thriller) that follow recognizable conventions and themes.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 21
Find the missing term in the series given below:1, 7, 25, 61, 121, ?, 337(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.205
  • B.211
  • C.209
  • D.208
Correct Answer: 211

Next difference = 60 + 30 = 90

Missing number = 121 + 90 = 211

Question 22
Which of the following is/are true?(A) The average of given data is less than the greatest observation and greater than the smallest observation of the given data.(B) If the observations of a given data are equal, then the average of the data may or may not be same as the observations.(C) If all the observations of a given data get increased by x, then their average is also increased by x.(D) If all the observations of a given data are divided by x, then their average may or may not change.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.(A), (B), (C) only
  • B.(B), (C), (D) only
  • C.(A), (C) only
  • D.(D) only
Correct Answer: (A), (C) only

Only statements A and C are true.

Question 23
The numerator of a fraction is 4 less than its denominator. If the numerator is decreased by 2 and denominator is increased by 1, then the denominator becomes 8 times the numerator, find the fraction.(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.3/7
  • B.3/9
  • C.3/8
  • D.2/7
Correct Answer: 3/7

Let x be the numerator.

Then, x-2x+4+1 = x8x

or x = 3

Fraction = 37

Question 24
A man sold an article at a profit of 6.5%. If he had sold the article for ₹ 1250 more, he would have earned a profit of 19%. What is the cost price of the article?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.₹ 1,0000
  • B.₹ 10,500
  • C.₹ 9,000
  • D.₹ 9,500
Correct Answer: ₹ 1,0000

Let CP = x

SP = 1.065x

New SP = 1.19x

Now, 1.19x – 1.065x = 1250

or x = 10000

Question 25
In a certain language:“Sun rises in the East” is coded as: “ST SR SI SH SS”“Sun sets in the West” is coded as: “ST SE SI SH SU”“Your house faces East” is coded as: “SN SM SA SS”“His house faces West” is coded as: “SC SM SA SU”How the words “East” and “West” are coded in this language respectively?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.SR, SE
  • B.SS, SN
  • C.SS, SU
  • D.SN, SC
Correct Answer: SS, SU

East = SS

West = SU

Question 26
"Either we forcibly sterilize the third world people or the world population will explode and all of us will die. We certainly don't want to die, therefore we must forcibly sterilize the third world people." Which informal fallacy is committed in the above argument?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Hasty generalization
  • B.Slippery slope
  • C.False Dichotomy
  • D.Ad hominem
Correct Answer: False Dichotomy

The argument presents a false dichotomy (also called a false dilemma) by suggesting that there are only two possible options:

1. Forcibly sterilize third world people.

2. The world population will explode and everyone will die.

 

This fallacy occurs because it ignores other possible solutions to population control and presents the situation as though only these two extreme options are available.

 

In a false dichotomy, the argument wrongly assumes that no middle ground exists between the two extremes.

Question 27
Which of the following statements are true?A. Propositions or statements can be true or false.B. Propositions can be valid or invalid.C. A valid argument must contain only true premises.D. A valid argument must have a true conclusion.E. In a valid argument, if its premises are true, the conclusion cannot be false.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and E only
  • B.C, D and E only
  • C.D and E only
  • D.A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A and E only

The correct answer is (A) A and E only

 

Explanation:

A. Propositions or statements can be true or false: This is true. Propositions are declarative statements that can either be true or false.

B. Propositions can be valid or invalid: This is false. Propositions themselves are not categorized as valid or invalid; validity applies to arguments, not individual propositions.

C. A valid argument must contain only true premises: This is false. A valid argument doesn't require the premises to be true. Validity simply means that if the premises are true, the conclusion must also be true. It doesn’t guarantee that the premises are true.

D. A valid argument must have a true conclusion: This is false. A valid argument doesn't require the conclusion to be true; it only ensures that if the premises are true, the conclusion will also be true. The conclusion can still be false if the premises are false.

E. In a valid argument, if its premises are true, the conclusion cannot be false: This is true. In a valid argument, if all premises are true, then the conclusion must also be true.

Thus, the correct answer is (A) A and E only.

Question 28
Arrange the following in the order of decreasing connotation.A. PolygonB. RectangleC. GeometryD. SquareChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.D, B, C, A
  • B.C, A, B, D
  • C.A, C, B, D
  • D.D, B, A, C
Correct Answer: D, B, A, C

Decreasing connotation refers to moving from specific terms to general terms. The more specific a term, the greater its connotation. The more general it is, the less its connotation.

 

Square – very specific; it refers to a type of rectangle where all sides are equal.

Rectangle – more general than square, but still specific (a type of polygon with four right angles).

Polygon – more general than rectangle, as it includes many shapes with straight sides.

Geometry – the most general term, covering a broad field of study related to shapes, space, and properties.

 

So, the correct order of decreasing connotation is:

D (Square) > B (Rectangle) > A (Polygon) > C (Geometry)

Question 29
Match the List–I with List–IIList I (Member as per Nyāya syllogism)A. UpanayaB. NigamanaC. UdāharanaD. PratijñāList II (Statement)I. Whoever is man is a mortal just like PythagorasII. Socrates is mortalIII. Socrates is a man who is invariably a mortalIV. Therefore Socrates is mortalChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A–II, B–IV, C–I, D–III
  • B.A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II
  • C.A–III, B–I, C–IV, D–II
  • D.A–III, B–II, C–IV, D–I
Correct Answer: A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II

The correct answer is (B) A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II

 

Explanation of Nyāya Syllogism (Indian Logic - 5 steps):

Pratijñā (Proposition) – Socrates is mortal. → D–II

(Statement to be proved)

 

Udāharaṇa (Example) – Whoever is man is mortal just like Pythagoras. → C–I

(Universal example supporting the reason)

 

Upanaya (Application) – Socrates is a man who is invariably a mortal. → A–III

(Application of universal rule to the particular case)

 

Nigamana (Conclusion) – Therefore, Socrates is mortal. → B–IV

Question 30
Which of the following fallacious arguments involves unproved middle term as per Nyāya logic?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Sound is eternal because it is produced.
  • B.Fire is cold because it is a substance.
  • C.The sky-lotus is fragrant, because it is a lotus, like the lotus of a lake.
  • D.The hill has fire because it is knowable.
Correct Answer: The sky-lotus is fragrant, because it is a lotus, like the lotus of a lake.

It is related to Ashrayasiddha.

 

Ashrayasiddha is the minor term is the locus of the middle term. If the minor term is unreal, the middle term cannot be present in it; e.g., ‘the sky-lotus is fragrant, because it is a lotus, like the lotus of a lake’.

Question 31
Which of the following is a software that locks data files and demands a monetary payment in exchange for unlocking?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Ransomware
  • B.Spyware
  • C.Logic Bomb
  • D.Trojan Horse
Correct Answer: Ransomware

The correct answer is option (A) - Ransomware.

 

Ransomware is a type of malicious software that encrypts a user's files or locks access to a system, demanding a ransom payment (usually in cryptocurrency) to restore access. It's commonly spread through phishing emails or exploit kits.

Question 32
Which of the following pair of acronym and its expansion is incorrectly matched?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.MIDI– Musical Instrument Digital Interchange
  • B.LED– Light Emitting Diode
  • C.MPEG– Motion Pictures Experts Group
  • D.PDF– Portable Document Format
Correct Answer: MIDI– Musical Instrument Digital Interchange

The correct answer is option (A) - MIDI – Musical Instrument Digital Interchange.

 

Incorrect: MIDI stands for Musical Instrument Digital Interface, not Interchange.

 

Correct Matches:

  • LED – Light Emitting Diode
  • MPEG – Motion Picture Experts Group
  • PDF – Portable Document Format
Question 33
IfLmrepresents a number L in base-M number system, then identify the correct descending order of the following numbers A–D when converted to decimal number system.A.1237B.12113C.2126D.2015Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, C, B, D
  • B.B, D, A, C
  • C.D, B, C, A
  • D.C, A, D, B
Correct Answer: C, A, D, B

1237 when converted to base 10 is 66

12113 when converted to base 10 is 49

2126 when converted to base 10 is 80

2015 when converted to base 10 is 51

Question 34
Which of the following software titles are examples of application software only?A. MS– ExcelB. AndroidC. Adobe PhotoshopD. iOSE. Windows– 11Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B and D only
  • C.A and C only
  • D.A and E only
Correct Answer: A and C only

The correct answer is option (C) - A and C only.

 

MS-Excel and Adobe Photoshop are application software because they are designed to perform specific tasks for the user, like spreadsheets (Excel) and image editing (Photoshop).

 

Android, iOS, and Windows-11 are operating systems, not application software, as they manage hardware and provide a platform for running application software.

Question 35
Match the List–I with List–IIList I (ICT Terms)A. PrinterB. ScannerC. RAMD. CPUList II (Meaning)I. Volatile memoryII. ProcessorIII. Output deviceIV. Input deviceChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A–II, B–III, C–IV, D–I
  • B.A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II
  • C.A–I, B–II, C–IV, D–III
  • D.A–III, B–IV, C–II, D–I
Correct Answer: A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II

The correct answer is option (B) - A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II.

 

A. Printer is an output device because it prints the output (text, images) from a computer.

 

B. Scanner is an input device because it scans physical documents and converts them into digital format.

 

C. RAM is volatile memory, meaning it loses its data when the power is turned off.

 

D. CPU is the processor that performs the calculations and processing tasks in a computer.

Question 36
Green Muffler is used to reduce(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Air Pollution
  • B.Water Pollution
  • C.Noise Pollution
  • D.Soil Pollution
Correct Answer: Noise Pollution

The correct answer is option (C) - Noise Pollution.

 

A green muffler is used to reduce noise pollution by absorbing sound waves and decreasing noise levels, typically in urban areas. It is usually made from natural materials like plants or trees, which can help absorb sound and provide a quieter environment.

Question 37
Which of the following has the highest Biological Oxygen Demand (BOD)?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Potable water
  • B.Unpolluted surface water
  • C.Contaminated surface water
  • D.Municipal Sewage Effluent
Correct Answer: Municipal Sewage Effluent

The correct answer is option (D) - Municipal Sewage Effluent.

 

Biological Oxygen Demand (BOD) refers to the amount of oxygen required by microorganisms to break down organic material in water. Municipal sewage effluent typically has the highest BOD due to the large amount of organic waste, such as food, human waste, and industrial discharges, which require significant oxygen for decomposition.

Question 38
Which of the following countries were asked to reduce their greenhouse emission by 5% below the level of 1990 by 2012 in Kyoto Protocol?A. United StatesB. IndiaC. RussiaD. CanadaE. ChinaChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, C and D only
  • B.C, D and E only
  • C.B, C and E only
  • D.B and E only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only

The correct answer is option A.

Question 39
What is the correct sequence of Risk assessment for environment contaminants?A. Exposure AssessmentB. Dose Response AssessmentC. Risk AssessmentD. Hazard IdentificationE. Risk CharacterizationChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.D, A, B, E, C
  • B.D, A, B, C, E
  • C.C, E, D, B, A
  • D.E, C, B, A, D
Correct Answer: D, A, B, E, C

The correct answer is: (A) D, A, B, E, C

 

The standard sequence for environmental risk assessment of contaminants typically follows these steps:

 

Hazard Identification (D):

Determine whether a particular chemical or agent has the potential to cause harm to humans or the environment.

 

Exposure Assessment (A):

Estimate how much, how often, and how long humans or ecological receptors are exposed to the agent.

 

Dose-Response Assessment (B):

Evaluate the relationship between the amount of exposure (dose) and the severity or frequency of the adverse health effect (response).

 

Risk Characterization (E):

Integrate information from the previous steps to describe the nature and magnitude of the health risk.

 

Risk Assessment (C):

This is the overall process that includes all the steps above — it’s not a separate step after risk characterization.

 

So, the logical sequence of components within the risk assessment is:

D (Hazard Identification) → A (Exposure Assessment) → B (Dose-Response) → E (Risk Characterization) → C (Overall Risk Assessment)

Question 40
Which of the following are considered as direct form of air pollutants?A. MistB. SootC. FogD. SmogE. Fly ashChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B and D only
  • B.B, D and E only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A, B and E only
Correct Answer: B, D and E only

The correct answer is: (B) B, D and E only

 

Let’s look at each option:

 

Mist (A):

Tiny water droplets suspended in the air — not a pollutant, it is a natural phenomenon.

 

Soot (B):

A black powdery or flaky substance consisting largely of carbon — yes, it is a pollutant, often from combustion.

 

Fog (C):

Condensed water vapor — not a pollutant, it's a natural weather condition.

 

Smog (D):

A harmful mix of smoke and fog, containing pollutants like ozone, sulfur dioxide — yes, it is an air pollutant.

 

Fly ash (E):

Fine particulate residue from burning coal — yes, it is a pollutant.

Question 41
The Anglo-Indian Vidyalaya (college) was founded in Calcutta in 1816 by(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.The Christian missionaries
  • B.The local government
  • C.The East India company
  • D.The people of Calcutta
Correct Answer: The people of Calcutta

"(The people of Calcutta) because the Anglo-Indian Vidyalaya was founded in 1816 by local citizens and community members, not just by Christian missionaries, the government, or the East India Company."

Question 42
Which one of the following personalities advocated western education for Indians in the early nineteenth century?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Rajaram Mohan Roy
  • B.Lord Hardinge
  • C.Mahatma Gandhi
  • D.Rabindranath Tagore
Correct Answer: Rajaram Mohan Roy

The correct answer is: (A) Rajaram Mohan Roy

 

Raja Ram Mohan Roy was a prominent social reformer in the early 19th century who strongly advocated for Western education, especially the study of science, mathematics, and philosophy in English. He believed that modern, rational education was key to India's progress and was instrumental in the founding of Hindu College (1817) in Calcutta.

Question 43
At the Sikh Kanya Mahvidyalaya, books written by which of the following Singh Sabha stalwarts were taught?A. Bhai Veer SinghB. Lala DevrajC. Harnam KaurD. Bhai Mohan Singh VaidChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.A and D only
  • C.A and C only
  • D.B and C only
Correct Answer: A and D only

The correct answer is option B.

 

The Sikh Kanya Mahavidyalaya situated in Ferozepur city was a renowned educational institution in the early 20th century. It was founded by Takht Singh. In 1901, Takht Singh established a library in the name of Ditt Singh, a Sikh polemicist of that period. It eventually developed a large collection of books related to Sikh history.

Question 44
Find out the chronological order of the following British Authorities /Persons who took interest in higher education in India.A. Lord CurzonB. Lord RiponC. Lord CanningD. Lord DalhousieChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, D, A, C
  • C.D, C, B, A
  • D.C, D, A, B
Correct Answer: D, C, B, A

The correct answer is: (C) D, C, B, A

 

Explanation:

Let’s arrange the British authorities chronologically based on their tenure and contributions to higher education in India:

 

Lord Dalhousie (1848–1856)

 

Advocated for the expansion of education; supported the development of infrastructure for schools and colleges.

 

Lord Canning (1856–1862)

 

First Viceroy of India; oversaw the establishment of universities in Calcutta, Bombay, and Madras in 1857.

 

Lord Ripon (1880–1884)

 

Promoted local self-government and encouraged education reforms, including support for vernacular and higher education.

 

Lord Curzon (1899–1905)

 

Known for the Indian Universities Commission (1902) and the Indian Universities Act (1904), which aimed to regulate and reform higher education.

 

Hence, the correct chronological order is:

D (Dalhousie) → C (Canning) → B (Ripon) → A (Curzon)

Question 45
Match the List–I with List–II.List I (Thinkers)A. BharatmuniB. PatanjaliC. VāgbhataD. BrahmaguptaList II (Text / Subject)I. AṣṭāṅgasaṃgrahaII. MahābhāṣyaIII. BrahmasphuṭasiddhāntaIV. NāṭyaśāstraChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A–IV, B–II, C–I, D–III
  • B.A–IV, B–I, C–II, D–III
  • C.A–III, B–I, C–II, D–IV
  • D.A–III, B–II, C–I, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–IV, B–II, C–I, D–III

The correct answer is: (A) A–IV, B–II, C–I, D–III

 

Explanation:

Let's match each thinker with their respective work:

 

A. Bharatmuni → IV. Nāṭyaśāstra

→ Bharatmuni is traditionally credited with writing the Nāṭyaśāstra, the foundational treatise on Indian performing arts, especially drama and dance.

 

B. Patanjali → II. Mahābhāṣya

→ Patanjali wrote the Mahābhāṣya, a major commentary on Panini's grammar, important in the field of Sanskrit grammar.

 

C. Vāgbhata → I. Aṣṭāṅgasaṃgraha

→ Vāgbhata was a classical author on Ayurveda and wrote the Aṣṭāṅgasaṃgraha and Aṣṭāṅgahṛdaya, foundational texts of Ayurvedic medicine.

 

D.Brahmagupta → III. Brahmasphuṭasiddhānta

→ Brahmagupta was an ancient Indian mathematician and astronomer who authored Brahmasphuṭasiddhānta, a key work in mathematics and astronomy.

Question 46
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions that follow:Nicotine is only found in tobacco and leads to cancer. But is it true? It is a natural ingredient found in several plants. Various vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes, potatoes among others, also contain nicotine in trace amounts.There are more than 7000 chemicals in cigarette smoke. Of these, at least 250 are known to be harmful to health, such as hydrogen cyanide, carbon monoxide and ammonia. Some are natural components of the tobacco plant itself, but most harmful substances are only formed on combustion of tobacco and not by nicotine itself.Products containing nicotine are often used to reduce anxiety, stress or depression. A survey in the ‘Human Centric Approach to Tobacco Control’ report highlights that stress and anxiety motivate tobacco consumption for 62% males and 40% females in tier I cities.Nicotine from cigarettes is absorbed into the lungs through inhalation of smoke. When nicotine enters the body, it enters the circulatory system and reaches the brain within 20 seconds, causing nerve stimulation resulting in feeling of euphoria.The burden of cancer and tobacco related diseases is immense. A recent report by WHO suggests that new cancer cases are likely to rise to at least thirty-five million in 2050, a 77% rise over the cases diagnosed in 2022. In India, an estimated 1.4 million cancer cases were recorded in the same year, while one in nine citizens could develop cancer in their lifetime.Which of the following statements accuracy describe the presence of nicotine in plants?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Nicotine is found in several plants, including some vegetables, in trace mounts
  • B.Nicotine is exclusively found in tobacco and not in any other plants
  • C.Nicotine is synthesized only in laboratories and not naturally found in plants
  • D.Nicotine is a by product of industrial processes and not naturally found
Correct Answer: Nicotine is found in several plants, including some vegetables, in trace mounts
Question 47
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions that follow:Nicotine is only found in tobacco and leads to cancer. But is it true? It is a natural ingredient found in several plants. Various vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes, potatoes among others, also contain nicotine in trace amounts.There are more than 7000 chemicals in cigarette smoke. Of these, at least 250 are known to be harmful to health, such as hydrogen cyanide, carbon monoxide and ammonia. Some are natural components of the tobacco plant itself, but most harmful substances are only formed on combustion of tobacco and not by nicotine itself.Products containing nicotine are often used to reduce anxiety, stress or depression. A survey in the ‘Human Centric Approach to Tobacco Control’ report highlights that stress and anxiety motivate tobacco consumption for 62% males and 40% females in tier I cities.Nicotine from cigarettes is absorbed into the lungs through inhalation of smoke. When nicotine enters the body, it enters the circulatory system and reaches the brain within 20 seconds, causing nerve stimulation resulting in feeling of euphoria.The burden of cancer and tobacco related diseases is immense. A recent report by WHO suggests that new cancer cases are likely to rise to at least thirty-five million in 2050, a 77% rise over the cases diagnosed in 2022. In India, an estimated 1.4 million cancer cases were recorded in the same year, while one in nine citizens could develop cancer in their lifetime.Which of the following harmful substances are produced upon combustion of tobacco?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Hydrogen cyanide and methane
  • B.Carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide
  • C.Nicotine and ammonia
  • D.Hydrogen cyanide, carbon monoxide and ammonia
Correct Answer: Hydrogen cyanide, carbon monoxide and ammonia

From the passage:

"There are more than 7000 chemicals in cigarette smoke. Of these, at least 250 are known to be harmful to health, such as hydrogen cyanide, carbon monoxide and ammonia."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 48
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions that follow:Nicotine is only found in tobacco and leads to cancer. But is it true? It is a natural ingredient found in several plants. Various vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes, potatoes among others, also contain nicotine in trace amounts.There are more than 7000 chemicals in cigarette smoke. Of these, at least 250 are known to be harmful to health, such as hydrogen cyanide, carbon monoxide and ammonia. Some are natural components of the tobacco plant itself, but most harmful substances are only formed on combustion of tobacco and not by nicotine itself.Products containing nicotine are often used to reduce anxiety, stress or depression. A survey in the ‘Human Centric Approach to Tobacco Control’ report highlights that stress and anxiety motivate tobacco consumption for 62% males and 40% females in tier I cities.Nicotine from cigarettes is absorbed into the lungs through inhalation of smoke. When nicotine enters the body, it enters the circulatory system and reaches the brain within 20 seconds, causing nerve stimulation resulting in feeling of euphoria.The burden of cancer and tobacco related diseases is immense. A recent report by WHO suggests that new cancer cases are likely to rise to at least thirty-five million in 2050, a 77% rise over the cases diagnosed in 2022. In India, an estimated 1.4 million cancer cases were recorded in the same year, while one in nine citizens could develop cancer in their lifetime.Therapeutic applications of Nicotine - containing products can be stated as follows:(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.They are used to increase physical strength
  • B.They are used to improve cognitive function.
  • C.They are used to reduce anxiety, stress and depression
  • D.They are mostly used as antibiotics
Correct Answer: They are used to reduce anxiety, stress and depression

. From the passage:

 

“Products containing nicotine are often used to reduce anxiety, stress or depression.”

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 49
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions that follow:Nicotine is only found in tobacco and leads to cancer. But is it true? It is a natural ingredient found in several plants. Various vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes, potatoes among others, also contain nicotine in trace amounts.There are more than 7000 chemicals in cigarette smoke. Of these, at least 250 are known to be harmful to health, such as hydrogen cyanide, carbon monoxide and ammonia. Some are natural components of the tobacco plant itself, but most harmful substances are only formed on combustion of tobacco and not by nicotine itself.Products containing nicotine are often used to reduce anxiety, stress or depression. A survey in the ‘Human Centric Approach to Tobacco Control’ report highlights that stress and anxiety motivate tobacco consumption for 62% males and 40% females in tier I cities.Nicotine from cigarettes is absorbed into the lungs through inhalation of smoke. When nicotine enters the body, it enters the circulatory system and reaches the brain within 20 seconds, causing nerve stimulation resulting in feeling of euphoria.The burden of cancer and tobacco related diseases is immense. A recent report by WHO suggests that new cancer cases are likely to rise to at least thirty-five million in 2050, a 77% rise over the cases diagnosed in 2022. In India, an estimated 1.4 million cancer cases were recorded in the same year, while one in nine citizens could develop cancer in their lifetime.What is the percentage of male in tier I cities who consume tobacco according to the ‘Human-Centric Approach to Tobacco Control’ report?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)

Question 50
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions that follow:Nicotine is only found in tobacco and leads to cancer. But is it true? It is a natural ingredient found in several plants. Various vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes, potatoes among others, also contain nicotine in trace amounts.There are more than 7000 chemicals in cigarette smoke. Of these, at least 250 are known to be harmful to health, such as hydrogen cyanide, carbon monoxide and ammonia. Some are natural components of the tobacco plant itself, but most harmful substances are only formed on combustion of tobacco and not by nicotine itself.Products containing nicotine are often used to reduce anxiety, stress or depression. A survey in the ‘Human Centric Approach to Tobacco Control’ report highlights that stress and anxiety motivate tobacco consumption for 62% males and 40% females in tier I cities.Nicotine from cigarettes is absorbed into the lungs through inhalation of smoke. When nicotine enters the body, it enters the circulatory system and reaches the brain within 20 seconds, causing nerve stimulation resulting in feeling of euphoria.The burden of cancer and tobacco related diseases is immense. A recent report by WHO suggests that new cancer cases are likely to rise to at least thirty-five million in 2050, a 77% rise over the cases diagnosed in 2022. In India, an estimated 1.4 million cancer cases were recorded in the same year, while one in nine citizens could develop cancer in their lifetime.What feelings does nicotine cause upon reaching the brain?(UGC NET 30 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Sleepiness
  • B.Depression
  • C.Hunger
  • D.Euphoria
Correct Answer: Euphoria

The passage clearly states:

 

"When nicotine enters the body, it enters the circulatory system and reaches the brain within 20 seconds, causing nerve stimulation resulting in feeling of euphoria."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Quiz Attempt #119712

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table presents the number of sports shoes produced by seven different companies A-G (in lakh) along with the percentage (%) of sports shoes rejected and percentage (%) of sports shoes sold by these companies during the years 2022 and 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.What is the percentage rise in the production of sports shoes by company C from the year 2022 to 2023?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.15.375 %
  • B.20.625 %
  • C.15.625 %
  • D.10.625 %
Correct Answer: 15.625 %

Percentage increase = 37-3232×100 = 15.625%

Question 2
The following table presents the number of sports shoes produced by seven different companies A-G (in lakh) along with the percentage (%) of sports shoes rejected and percentage (%) of sports shoes sold by these companies during the years 2022 and 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.What is the percentage rise in the sale of sports shoes by company F from the year 2022 to 2023?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.12 %
  • B.25 %
  • C.14 %
  • D.20 %
Correct Answer: 20 %

Percentage increase = 24×0.81-18×0.918×0.9 × 100 = 20%

Question 3
The following table presents the number of sports shoes produced by seven different companies A-G (in lakh) along with the percentage (%) of sports shoes rejected and percentage (%) of sports shoes sold by these companies during the years 2022 and 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.What is the total number of rejected sports shoes from all the companies together in year 2022?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.835000
  • B.835020
  • C.835040
  • D.835080
Correct Answer: 835000

Total Rejected Shoes in 2022 = 0.75 + 1.30 + 0.64 + 2.16 + 1.40 + 0.90 + 1.20 = 8.35 lakh

Question 4
The following table presents the number of sports shoes produced by seven different companies A-G (in lakh) along with the percentage (%) of sports shoes rejected and percentage (%) of sports shoes sold by these companies during the years 2022 and 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.The total number of sports shoes sold by all companies in year 2023 is approximately ________ % of the total number of sports shoes produced by all the companies in that year.(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.84
  • B.79
  • C.72
  • D.75
Correct Answer: 79

Total Produced = 33 + 30 + 37 + 32 + 41 + 24 + 35 = 232 lakh

Total Sold = 23.76 + 22.80 + 30.34 + 27.84 + 32.80 + 19.44 + 27.30 = 184.28 lakh

Percentage = 184.28232 × 100 ≈ 79%

Question 5
The following table presents the number of sports shoes produced by seven different companies A-G (in lakh) along with the percentage (%) of sports shoes rejected and percentage (%) of sports shoes sold by these companies during the years 2022 and 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Percentage rise in the production of sports shoes from the year 2022 to 2023 is more than 25% for exactly ________ companies.(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.2
  • B.3
  • C.4
  • D.5
Correct Answer: 3

For companies A, D and F its more than 25%

Question 6
To teach a particular topic a teacher first gives the students to watch the pre-recorded video of the lecture at home and then engages the students in discussions and problem-solving activities in the class. This is an example of:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Lecture-demonstration
  • B.Flipped classroom
  • C.Asynchronous learning
  • D.Synchronous learning
Correct Answer: Flipped classroom

In a flipped classroom model, the traditional teaching approach is reversed:

 

Learning basic content (like watching a lecture video) happens at home.

 

Class time is used for interactive, higher-order learning activities, such as discussions, problem-solving, and group work.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 7
Which component of Baddeley’s basic working memory model is involved in the task of Rapid repetition of the word like “See-Saw”?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Visuospatial sketchpad
  • B.Bounded rationality
  • C.Phonological loop
  • D.Meta-cognition
Correct Answer: Phonological loop

The Phonological Loop is a component of Baddeley’s Working Memory Model responsible for handling verbal and auditory information. It is involved in repeating words or sounds in your mind (known as subvocal rehearsal), such as the rapid repetition of a word like “See-Saw.”

 

The Working Memory Model, proposed by Baddeley and Hitch in 1974, describes short-term memory as a system with multiple components.

 

It comprises the central executive, which controls attention and coordinates the phonological loop (handling auditory information), and the visuospatial sketchpad (processing visual and spatial information).

 

Later, the episodic buffer was added to integrate information across these systems and link to long-term memory. This model suggests that short-term memory is dynamic and multifaceted.

 

Thus, option (C) is correct.

Question 8
A teacher wants his students to watch pre-recorded videos and answer questions embedded in the videos. Which tool would be most suitable for this purpose?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Edpuzzle
  • B.Evernote
  • C.Google Docs
  • D.Strawpoll
Correct Answer: Edpuzzle

Edpuzzle is an interactive video tool specifically designed for educators to:

  • Assign pre-recorded videos
  • Embed questions (MCQs, short answers) within the videos
  • Track student progress and responses.

 

Other options:

(B) Evernote – A note-taking app, not for interactive videos

 

(C) Google Docs – Good for collaboration on text, not video-based interaction

 

(D) Strawpoll – Used for simple polls, not video lessons

Question 9
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Swayamprabha Channel No.):A. Channel : 04B. Channel : 05C. Channel : 06D. Channel : 07List - II (Name):(I) Kautilya(II) Vidhik(III) Prabandhan(IV) SaaraswatChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(III), B-(II), C-(IV), D-(I)
  • B.A-(IV), B-(III), C-(II), D-(I)
  • C.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • D.A-(II), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(IV), B-(III), C-(II), D-(I)

The correct match is as follows:

 

List - I (Swayamprabha Channel No.):
A. Channel : 04 - Saaraswat

B. Channel : 05 - Prabandhan
C. Channel : 06 - Vidhik
D. Channel : 07 - Kautilya

Question 10
An instructor uses portfolio assessments in an art class. What key components should be included in the students’ portfolios?A. Collection of completed art worksB. Reflective essays on their creative processC. Standardized test scoresD. Peer feedback and critiquesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.B and C Only
  • B.A, B and D Only
  • C.A and C Only
  • D.C and D Only
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

A portfolio assessment in an art class is designed to showcase student learning, creativity, progress, and reflection. Key components typically include:

 

A. Collection of completed artworks – to demonstrate skill and creative output.

 

B. Reflective essays – help students explain their thought process, learning, and artistic development.

 

D. Peer feedback and critiques – provide additional perspectives and encourage collaborative learning.

 

C. Standardized test scores are not relevant in an art portfolio, as they don’t reflect creativity or the artistic process.

Question 11
According to UGC Regulations 2018 on Plagiarism, which of the following percentages of similarity in a research article would result in debarring a university teacher from supervising a Ph.D. Student for a period of two years?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.27 %
  • B.38 %
  • C.44 %
  • D.65 %
Correct Answer: 44 %

According to UGC Regulations 2018 on Plagiarism, Level 2 plagiarism is defined as similarities above 40% to 60%. In cases of Level 2 plagiarism:

The researcher will be asked to withdraw the manuscript submitted for publication.

They will be denied the right to publish any work for a minimum period of two years.

They will also be denied one annual increment.

Additionally, the individual will not be allowed to supervise any UG, PG, Master's, M.Phil., or Ph.D. students for a period of two years.

Thus, the correct similarity percentage that leads to these consequences is 40% to 60%, which corresponds to 44% as the correct option. The correct answer is (C) 44%.

Question 12
Which of the following methods of graphical representation of data would be useful in showing association between two variables?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Ogive
  • B.Pie charts
  • C.Histogram
  • D.Scatter plots
Correct Answer: Scatter plots

To show the association between two variables, the best method of graphical representation is a scatter plot.

(A) Ogive: An ogive is used to show cumulative frequencies of data, not associations between two variables.

(B) Pie charts: Pie charts are used to represent parts of a whole (proportional data), not associations between two variables.

(C) Histogram: A histogram is useful for showing the frequency distribution of a single variable, not the relationship between two variables.

(D) Scatter plots: Scatter plots are ideal for showing the relationship (association) between two continuous variables. They plot data points on an X-Y axis, making it easy to observe correlations or patterns.

Thus, the correct answer is (D) Scatter plots.

Question 13
Identify the threats to internal validity.A. Selection threatB. Maturation threatC. Attrition threatD. Testing threatChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.A, C and D Only
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

Threats to internal validity refer to factors that can undermine the accuracy of the conclusions drawn from a study, particularly the causal relationship between variables. Here's a breakdown of each threat:

A. Selection threat: Occurs when participants in different groups are not randomly assigned, leading to differences that might affect the study's outcome. This threatens internal validity because the differences between groups may not be due to the treatment being studied.

B. Maturation threat: Refers to natural changes in participants over time that could influence the results. For example, people might become older, wiser, or more experienced during the study, which could affect the outcome.

C. Attrition threat: Occurs when participants drop out of the study over time, leading to a loss of data. If the drop-out is not random, it can bias the results.

D. Testing threat: Happens when participants' performance on a test is influenced by prior testing. For instance, repeated exposure to a test can improve scores, not because of the treatment, but due to familiarity with the test.

Question 14
Arrange the datasets with the following means (x̄) and standard deviations (σ) in decreasing order of their coefficients of variation.A. σ = 4.3, x̄ = 13.8B. σ = 3.8, x̄ = 12.7C. σ = 5.7, x̄ = 14.9D. σ = 4.7, x̄ = 14.1Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, C, D, A
  • C.C, D, A, B
  • D.D, A, B, C
Correct Answer: C, D, A, B

To arrange the data sets in increasing order of their coefficient of variation (CV), we need to calculate the CV for each dataset. The coefficient of variation is given by the formula:

Question 15
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Scale of Measurement)A. NominalB. OrdinalC. IntervalD. RatioList - II (Example of Variable)(I) Height of students(II) Time of Day(III) Caste(IV) Rank of Army personnelChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
  • C.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(II), D-(I)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(IV), C-(II), D-(I)

Let’s go through each scale of measurement and match it with the correct example:

 

A. Nominal: This scale classifies data into categories that do not have a meaningful order or ranking. Caste is an example of a nominal variable, as it divides people into distinct categories with no inherent order. Matches with (III) Caste.

B. Ordinal: This scale involves categories with a meaningful order, but the distances between the categories are not necessarily equal. Rank of Army personnel is an example of an ordinal variable, as ranks have a clear order (e.g., General > Colonel). Matches with (IV) Rank of Army personnel.

C. Interval: This scale has ordered categories with equal distances between them, but it lacks a true zero point. Time of day is an example of an interval variable because the difference between times is consistent, but the "zero" time is arbitrary (e.g., 12:00 PM is not the absence of time). Matches with (II) Time of Day.

D. Ratio: This scale has all the properties of the interval scale but also includes a meaningful zero point. Height of students is an example of a ratio variable, as zero height represents the complete absence of height, and the differences are meaningful. Matches with (I) Height of students.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) A-(III), B-(IV), C-(II), D-(I).

Question 16
The major difference between Television and Cinema is:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Eye movement
  • B.Sound reverberation
  • C.Bandwidth
  • D.Liveness differential
Correct Answer: Liveness differential

The major difference between Television and Cinema lies in the “liveness differential”:

 

Television often broadcasts live or current events (e.g., news, sports, reality shows).

 

Cinema, on the other hand, is pre-recorded, edited, and curated for theatrical release.

 

This difference in real-time vs. recorded experience is referred to as liveness differential.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 17
According to David Holmes, the textual or behavioural qualities of communication are determined by the architecture of the particular _________.(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Medium
  • B.Message
  • C.Noise
  • D.Ideology
Correct Answer: Medium

David Holmes, in his work on communication and media theory, emphasizes the role of the medium in shaping the textual and behavioural qualities of communication. This idea aligns with the famous assertion by Marshall McLuhan that "the medium is the message", meaning that the form of a medium embeds itself in the message, influencing how the message is perceived.

 

In Holmes’ perspective, each medium (like print, television, internet, etc.) has its own architecture, which determines:

  • the structure of how information is presented (textual quality)
  • the interaction patterns between sender and receiver (behavioural quality)

 

For example:

  • A printed book encourages linear, deep reading.
  • A social media platform promotes short, interactive, rapid exchanges.

 

Thus, the medium itself shapes the communication, not just the content of the message.

Question 18
The medium of Internet is described as:A. Restricted possibilityB. Unimpressive theologyC. UniversalistD. RedemptiveE. Electronic assemblyChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C Only
  • B.B, C, D Only
  • C.C, D, E Only
  • D.A, B, E Only
Correct Answer: C, D, E Only

In media and communication theory, the Internet is often described using the following terms:

  • Universalist (C): The internet is seen as a global medium with the potential to connect all people and cultures — a universal space for communication, information, and expression.
  • Redemptive (D): Some theorists describe the internet in utopian terms, portraying it as a force for social good, democratization, and empowerment — almost with redemptive qualities, offering solutions to political, social, or economic problems.
  • Electronic assembly (E): The term reflects how the internet enables collective action, online forums, digital protests, and participatory culture — acting as a platform for public gathering and discourse.

 

The other options: Restricted possibility (A) and Unimpressive theology (B) are not standard descriptions of the internet in academic or theoretical discourse.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 19
Identify the correct sequence of the following modes of communication:A. WrittenB. Face-to-faceC. PrintD. BroadcastingE. DatacastingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, C, B, E, D
  • B.B, A, C, D, E
  • C.C, D, E, A, B
  • D.D, E, A, B, C
Correct Answer: B, A, C, D, E

This question tests the chronological evolution of modes of communication — from the earliest to the most recent forms.

 

Let’s examine the correct sequence:

  • Face-to-face (B) – This is the oldest and most natural form of communication, existing since the origin of human language and interaction.
  • Written (A) – Writing developed after speech as a way to preserve and communicate across time and space.
  • Print (C) – The invention of the printing press (15th century) revolutionized written communication by making mass distribution possible.
  • Broadcasting (D) – Emerged in the 20th century with the development of radio and television, allowing one-to-many communication.
  • Datacasting (E) – A digital era mode, refers to broadcasting data over digital television or radio signals, representing the latest evolution.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 20
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Concept)A. Closed textB. Principle of safetyC. OralityD. ClusterList - II (Description)(I) Verbal expressions(II) Basic rhetorical structure(III) A text to elicit a single response(IV) Avoidance of riskChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
  • C.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)

Let’s match each concept with its correct description:

 

A. Closed text → (III) A text to elicit a single response

A closed text is structured to lead the audience to one specific interpretation or meaning — it's tightly controlled in meaning.

 

B. Principle of safety → (IV) Avoidance of risk

This principle emphasizes minimizing risk and uncertainty, often used in media regulations or ethical communication practices.

 

C. Orality → (I) Verbal expressions

Orality refers to spoken communication, or verbal expression, as opposed to written or printed forms.

 

D. Cluster → (II) Basic rhetorical structure

In communication theory, a cluster refers to grouping related ideas or terms, forming a rhetorical structure or pattern for meaning-making.

 

Thus, the correct match is: (C) A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II).

Question 21
Find the value of the expression:[(0.12 × 0.12 × 0.12) + (0.012 × 0.012 × 0.012)]/[(0.48 × 0.48 × 0.48) + (0.048 × 0.048 × 0.048)](UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.1/16
  • B.1/4
  • C.4
  • D.1/64
Correct Answer: 1/64

[(0.12 × 0.12 × 0.12) + (0.012 × 0.012 × 0.012)][(0.48 × 0.48 × 0.48) + (0.048 × 0.048 × 0.048)] = 0.0123(1000+1)0.0243(1000+1) = 164

Question 22
Consider the series given below. Find the number which can be inserted at the place of question mark (?).5, 14, 39, 88, 209, ?, 667(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.378
  • B.297
  • C.299
  • D.375
Correct Answer: 378

14 − 5 = 9

39 − 14 = 25

88 − 39 = 49

209 − 88 = 121

So, next term will be 209 + 169 = 378

Question 23
Which of the following is/are true?A. If the selling price (SP) of an article is ₹ 40 and the gain is 15 %, the cost price (CP) of the article is ₹ 32B. A man bought a toy for ₹ 150 and sold it at a profit of 8 %. He sold the toy for ₹ 162C. A man buys a cycle for ₹ 500, but due to some problem, he sells it for ₹ 400. He thus incurs a loss of 22 %D. Cost price of an article, if its SP is ₹ 210 and the loss is 30 %, is ₹ 300Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A Only
  • B.A and D Only
  • C.B and D Only
  • D.B and C Only
Correct Answer: B and D Only

Only statements B and D are correct.

Question 24
In a certain code language:"Bitter patience sweet fruit" is coded as: "Bo Po So To""Art is sweet happiness" is coded as: "Ao Io So Ho""Hoping is concealing bitter" is coded as: "Hp Io Co Bo""Patience is art of hoping" is coded as: "Po Io Ao Fo Hp"How "Patience is happiness" will be coded in this language?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Ho Io Po
  • B.Hp Ao Po
  • C.Po Ao Ho
  • D.Po Io Ho
Correct Answer: Po Io Ho

Code for Happiness is Ho.

Question 25
A man invests ₹ 1550 in two parts, one part at the rate of 8% interest and another part at the rate of 6 %. If the total interest earned in one year is ₹ 106, find the amount invested at each rate of interest, respectively.(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.₹ 650 and ₹ 900
  • B.₹ 700 and ₹ 850
  • C.₹ 750 and ₹ 800
  • D.₹ 800 and ₹ 750
Correct Answer: ₹ 650 and ₹ 900

x×8×1100 + (1550-x)×6×1100 = 106

or x = 650

Investment @ 8% = 650

Investment @ 6% = 900

Question 26
“If one eats mushrooms after a long gap of time, one falls ill. I have been having some digestive issues since morning today, therefore there must have been mushroom in that mixed vegetable soup we had last night” which fallacy, if any, committed in the above argument?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.It is a valid argument
  • B.Affirming the consequent
  • C.Hasty Generalization
  • D.Begging the question
Correct Answer: Affirming the consequent

The correct answer is (B) Affirming the consequent

 

This argument commits the fallacy of affirming the consequent, which occurs when someone assumes that just because a specific outcome (consequence) occurred, it must have been caused by a specific condition (antecedent).

 

The structure of the argument can be written as:

If one eats mushrooms after a long gap of time, one falls ill. (If P, then Q)

The person is feeling ill. (Q)

 

Therefore, mushrooms must have been in the soup. (P)

Question 27
If the statement “Some rectangles are squares” is given as true then which of the following statements can be inferred to be false.A. All rectangles are squaresB. Some rectangles are not squaresC. Some squares are not rectanglesD. No rectangles are squaresChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.B, C and D Only
  • B.D Only
  • C.B and C Only
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: D Only

If I is given as true THEN E is false; A and O are undetermined. Hence “No rectangles are squares” Type- E is false.

Question 28
Which of the following propositions are contradictory?A. All squares are rectanglesB. No squares are rectanglesC. Some squares are rectanglesD. Some squares are not rectanglesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.C and D Only
  • B.A and D Only
  • C.B and D Only
  • D.A and B Only
Correct Answer: A and D Only

Type A (All X and Y) and Type O (Some X are not Y) are contradictory to each other.

Question 29
From the following identify the propositions that are logically equivalent.A. Some books are novelsB. Some books are not non-novelsC. Some novels are not non-booksD. Some novels are booksChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.C and D Only
  • B.B and D Only
  • C.A and C Only
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

All four statements are equivalents to each other.

Question 30
“Somdutta who is never seen eating during the day time is constantly gaining weight. Therefore, she must be eating during the night time”. As per classical Indian philosophy which instrument of knowledge is used in the above statement?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Perception
  • B.Analogy
  • C.Verbal authority
  • D.Postulation
Correct Answer: Postulation

The correct answer is option (D) - Postulation.

 

In classical Indian philosophy, postulation (or "arthāpatti") is a form of inferential knowledge. It involves assuming something as true in order to explain a particular phenomenon. In this case, the statement postulates that since Somdutta is gaining weight despite not eating during the day, she must be eating at night to account for her weight gain. This reasoning is based on the necessity of an assumption to explain the observed facts.

Question 31
Which of the following is a software that displays unwanted or sometimes irritating pop-up advertisements which can appear on your computer or mobile phone?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Spyware
  • B.Adware
  • C.Worm
  • D.Trojan Horse
Correct Answer: Adware

The correct answer is (B) Adware.

 

Explanation: Adware is a type of software that displays unwanted advertisements, often in the form of pop-ups, on your computer or mobile device. These ads are typically shown without the user's consent, and while adware itself is not necessarily malicious, it can be irritating and may collect data to serve targeted ads.

Question 32
Microsoft Access is an example of a(n) ________.(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Operational resource toolkit system
  • B.ERP system
  • C.Database management system
  • D.Knowledge management system
Correct Answer: Database management system

The correct answer is (C) Database management system.

 

Explanation: Microsoft Access is a Database Management System (DBMS). It allows users to create, manage, and query databases, helping with storing and organizing data efficiently. It is part of the Microsoft Office suite and provides tools for creating databases, forms, queries, and reports.

Question 33
On the basis of the coverage area, identify the correct ascending order of the following four types of computer networks A-D:A. WANB. LANC. MAND. PANChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.D, B, C, A
  • B.B, C, A, D
  • C.D, C, B, A
  • D.A, B, D, C
Correct Answer: D, B, C, A

The correct answer is (A) D, B, C, A.

 

PAN (Personal Area Network) has the smallest coverage area, typically used for connecting devices within a small personal area like a room.

 

LAN (Local Area Network) covers a larger area than PAN, typically within a building or a campus.

 

MAN (Metropolitan Area Network) covers a larger area than LAN, often spanning a city or a large campus.

 

WAN (Wide Area Network) has the largest coverage area, spanning cities, countries, or even continents, and can connect multiple LANs and MANs.

 

Thus, the ascending order is: PAN < LAN < MAN < WAN.

Question 34
Which of the following devices are computer output devices only?A. ScannerB. PlotterC. Light penD. ProjectorE. SpeakerChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, D and E Only
  • B.D and E Only
  • C.A, B and C Only
  • D.B, D and E Only
Correct Answer: B, D and E Only

The correct answer is (D) B, D and E Only.

 

Plotter is an output device that produces drawings and graphics on paper.

 

Projector is an output device that displays images or videos onto a screen.

 

Speaker is an output device that produces sound.

 

Other devices:
