Question 50
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow.Adolescence is the most important period of human life. Poets have described it as the spring of life of human being and an important era in the total life span. The word adolescence comes from a Greek word ‘adolescere’ which means ‘to grow to maturity’. A number of definitions have been given by Psychologists from time to time. Some Psychologists define it as the transitional period of life. The child experiences a number of changes in this transitional period. The period runs between childhood and adulthood and is sometimes called the period of teenage.According to A. T. Jersild “Adolescence is that span of years during which boys and girls move from childhood to adulthood, mentally, emotionally, socially and physically”.Chronologically adolescence comes roughly in between the years from 12 to the early 20’s. The onset of adolescence varies from culture to culture depending on the socio-economic conditions of the country. In this period, great changes occur in all developmental dimensions of the individual.Which of the following statements about adolescence is true?(UGC NET 29 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Adolescence is a period in between the years from 12 to the early 20's.
  • B.No one can predict exactly when adolescence commences.
  • C.Adolescents are incompetent in tackling science and mathematics puzzles.
  • D.Adolescence does not include any physical and psychological change.
Correct Answer: Adolescence is a period in between the years from 12 to the early 20's.

According to passage, the correct answer is option (A) i.e., Adolescence is a period in between the years from 12 to the early 20's.

Quiz Attempt #119714

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the number of Votes polled (in lakh) during opinion polls that were conducted to know about the popularity of four IT Companies A, B, C and D, in alternate months, namely, January, March, May, July, September and November, in a given year. All the people who participated in the opinion poll each month have definitely casted their vote in favour of any of the four companies. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.The number of votes polled in favour of A and C, taken together in January, May and September is approximately ______ % less than the number of votes polled in favour of B and D, taken together in March, July and November.(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.27
  • B.37
  • C.44
  • D.18
Correct Answer: 27

Required percentage = 18.5-13.518.5×100 ≈ 27%

Question 2
The following table shows the number of Votes polled (in lakh) during opinion polls that were conducted to know about the popularity of four IT Companies A, B, C and D, in alternate months, namely, January, March, May, July, September and November, in a given year. All the people who participated in the opinion poll each month have definitely casted their vote in favour of any of the four companies. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.What is the ratio of percentage decline in votes of B in May in comparison to January to the percentage decline in votes of C in November in comparison to January?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.6 : 7
  • B.7 : 6
  • C.6 : 5
  • D.4 : 3
Correct Answer: 6 : 5

Company B decline % = 2.5-12.5×100 = 60%

Company C decline % = 3-1.53×100 = 50%

Ratio = 60%50% = 6 : 5

Question 3
The following table shows the number of Votes polled (in lakh) during opinion polls that were conducted to know about the popularity of four IT Companies A, B, C and D, in alternate months, namely, January, March, May, July, September and November, in a given year. All the people who participated in the opinion poll each month have definitely casted their vote in favour of any of the four companies. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.In all the six months combined, ______ % more votes are required by company A to equal the total votes polled by company D.(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.150
  • B.145
  • C.133
  • D.88
Correct Answer: 145

Total A = 1.5 + 1.0 + 1.0 + 1.5 + 2.0 + 3.0 = 10.0 lakh

Total D = 4.0 + 4.0 + 3.5 + 4.5 + 4.5 + 4.0 = 24.5 lakh

Difference = 24.5 - 10.0 = 14.5 lakh

% more required = 14.510×100 = 145%

Question 4
The following table shows the number of Votes polled (in lakh) during opinion polls that were conducted to know about the popularity of four IT Companies A, B, C and D, in alternate months, namely, January, March, May, July, September and November, in a given year. All the people who participated in the opinion poll each month have definitely casted their vote in favour of any of the four companies. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.As per table, in the month of July, the votes of D and C are in the ratio 9 : 5. If the votes of D remain same, then the votes of C should increase by ______ % to make the ratio 5 : 9 (in the month of July).(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.80
  • B.124
  • C.144
  • D.224
Correct Answer: 224

4.52.5+x = 59

or x = 5.6

% increase in voters of C = 5.62.5×100= 224%

Question 5
The following table shows the number of Votes polled (in lakh) during opinion polls that were conducted to know about the popularity of four IT Companies A, B, C and D, in alternate months, namely, January, March, May, July, September and November, in a given year. All the people who participated in the opinion poll each month have definitely casted their vote in favour of any of the four companies. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.In the month of September, the additional number of votes needed by A and B together to get 7% more votes than D is _____.(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.91300
  • B.81500
  • C.14400
  • D.71200
Correct Answer: 81500

Current voters = 4

Targeted voters = 4.5 × 1.07 = 4.815

Additional voters needed = 4.815 – 5 = 0.815 lakh = 81500

Question 6
Which of the following best exemplifies the zero transfer of learning?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Using knowledge of one programming language to another similar language
  • B.Applying techniques of learning in basketball to improve skills in soccer
  • C.Using skills acquired in carpentry to excel in painting
  • D.Applying a mathematical problem-solving method to physics problems
Correct Answer: Using skills acquired in carpentry to excel in painting

Zero transfer of learning occurs when previous learning has no effect—positive or negative—on the new learning task. In other words, the skills or knowledge from one domain do not transfer or apply to another.

 

Let’s examine each option:

 

(A) Using knowledge of one programming language to another similar language

This is positive transfer, as similarities between languages (e.g., syntax, logic) help learning.

 

(B) Applying techniques of learning in basketball to improve skills in soccer

This is positive transfer, since both are team sports involving coordination and movement.

 

(C) Using skills acquired in carpentry to excel in painting

This is an example of zero transfer, as manual woodworking skills don’t significantly help in color mixing or brushwork in painting.

 

(D) Applying a mathematical problem-solving method to physics problems

This is positive transfer, as physics often requires mathematical reasoning.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 7
Which of the following channels of Swayamprabha are under the Consortium for Educational Communication (CEC), New Delhi?A. Channel 11B. Channel 1C. Channel 15D. Channel 3E. Channel 6Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C and E Only
  • B.C, D and E Only
  • C.A and C Only
  • D.B, D and E Only
Correct Answer: B, D and E Only

The following channels are under the Consortium for Educational Communication (CEC), New Delhi, for which CEC is the national coordinator:

  • Channel 01: VAGEESH: CEC/UGC: Humanities- 1, Language and Literature
  • Channel 03: PRABODH: CEC/UGC: Social Science -1, Social & Behavioral Sciences
  • Channel 06: VIDHIK: CEC/UGC: Social Science - 4, Law, Legal Studies, Human Rights and related subjects

 

Hence, the correct answer is option (D).

 

Channel 11 – under IGNOU, New Delhi

Channel 15 – under IGNOU, New Delhi

Question 8
Match List–I with List–II.List–I (App)A. LabsterB. Google EarthC. KahootD. Poll EverywhereList–II (Use)I. Real-time pollingII. Virtual labs and simulationsIII. Virtual field trips and geographic explorationIV. Online quizzes and assessmentsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I
  • B.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
  • C.A–II, B–III, C–IV, D–I
  • D.A–III, B–I, C–II, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–II, B–III, C–IV, D–I

The correct answer is option (C), i.e., A–II, B–III, C–IV, D–I.

A. Labster → II. Virtual labs and simulations

Labster provides 3D virtual science laboratories where students can do experiments in biology, chemistry, and physics. It’s ideal for simulating lab environments online.

 

B. Google Earth → III. Virtual field trips and geographic exploration

Google Earth allows students to explore locations around the world, view satellite images, and even take virtual geography field trips. It’s widely used in social studies and geography classes.

 

C. Kahoot → IV. Online quizzes and assessments

Kahoot is a fun, game-based learning platform where teachers create quizzes and polls to test students in real time, making assessments interactive and engaging.

 

D. Poll Everywhere → I. Real-time polling

Poll Everywhere lets teachers or presenters collect live responses from students or audience members during classes, useful for quick feedback or engagement.

Question 9
A teacher wants to integrate SWAYAM into the curriculum to enhance learning. Which of the following benefits of SWAYAM should the teacher highlight to the students?A. Free access to quality educational resourcesB. Opportunity for live interactions with instructionsC. Peer-reviewed assignmentsD. Self-paced learningChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.B, C and D Only
  • B.A and D Only
  • C.D Only
  • D.A and B Only
Correct Answer: A and D Only

SWAYAM (Study Webs of Active-Learning for Young Aspiring Minds) is an initiative by the Government of India that offers free online courses from institutions like IITs, IIMs, and central universities.

 

Here are the benefits relevant to the options:

A. Free access to quality educational resources

– SWAYAM provides high-quality, free online content across disciplines, accessible to any learner.

 

B. Opportunity for live interactions with instructors

– Most SWAYAM courses are pre-recorded and asynchronous, not focused on real-time/live interaction.

 

C. Peer-reviewed assignments

– While some assignments are auto-graded or instructor-evaluated, peer-review is not a prominent feature on SWAYAM.

 

D. Self-paced learning

– Learners can access content at their own pace, which is a key benefit of online platforms like SWAYAM.

Question 10
The reduced ability to remember information acquired after the onset of Amnesia is known as:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Working memory
  • B.Retrograde amnesia
  • C.Phonological loop
  • D.Anterograde amnesia
Correct Answer: Anterograde amnesia

Anterograde amnesia refers to the inability to form new memories after the onset of amnesia.

It means the person cannot remember information learned after the brain damages or trauma occurred.

 

Example: A person with anterograde amnesia might remember events from years ago but not recall what they ate for lunch an hour ago.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 11
The tendency of people being observed to act differently than normal as a result of their awareness of being monitored, refers to:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Subject reactivity
  • B.Observer bias
  • C.Observer drift
  • D.De briefing
Correct Answer: Subject reactivity

The phenomenon where people act differently because they are aware that they are being observed is called (A) Subject reactivity.

(A) Subject reactivity: This occurs when participants alter their behavior due to the awareness that they are being observed. This can impact the authenticity of their behavior and the validity of the research findings.

(B) Observer bias: This refers to the tendency of the researcher to unintentionally influence the results of the study based on their expectations or preconceived beliefs about the outcomes.

(C) Observer drift: This happens when the observer's standards or definitions change over time, leading to inconsistency in the observations.

(D) Debriefing: This is the process of informing participants about the true nature of the study after it has been completed, especially in studies where deception was used.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (A) Subject reactivity.

Question 12
Which of the following methods of graphical representation of data would be useful for depicting proportions?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Line charts
  • B.Histograms
  • C.Pie charts
  • D.Scatter plots
Correct Answer: Pie charts

To depict proportions, the most appropriate graphical method is (C) Pie charts.

(A) Line charts: These are used to display data trends over time, not particularly for depicting proportions.

(B) Histograms: These are useful for showing the frequency distribution of continuous data but not for depicting proportions of categories.

(C) Pie charts: Pie charts are specifically designed to show proportions. They represent parts of a whole, making it easy to visualize how different categories contribute to the total.

(D) Scatter plots: These are used to depict the relationship between two continuous variables, not for proportions.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (C) Pie charts.

Question 13
Identify the main pre-occupations of quantitative researchers:A. MeasurementB. CausalityC. DescriptionD. GeneralizationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.A, B and D Only
  • D.A, C and D Only
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

Quantitative research primarily focuses on the following preoccupations:

A. Measurement: Quantitative research involves precise measurement of variables using tools such as surveys, scales, and instruments to collect numerical data.

B. Causality: Quantitative research is often focused on determining causal relationships between variables, where one variable influences or causes a change in another.

C. Description: While quantitative research does involve describing data (e.g., through statistical summaries), it is less focused on detailed descriptions compared to qualitative research.

D. Generalization: One of the key goals of quantitative research is to generalize findings from a sample to a larger population, making statistical inference and generalization a core element.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (C) A, B and D Only, as these elements are central to quantitative research. Description is more of a secondary concern compared to the other three.

Question 14
Arrange the following statistical measures in increasing order:A. Sixth decileB. MedianC. Third quartileD. 67th percentileChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, D, B, C
  • B.B, C, A, D
  • C.B, A, D, C
  • D.A, C, D, B
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C

The values are ordered in terms of their position in the data set, based on percentiles or quantiles. Here’s how each value fits:

Median: The median is the 50th percentile, which divides the data into two equal halves.

Sixth decile: The sixth decile is the 60th percentile, meaning it is higher than the median but lower than the 67th percentile.

Third quartile: The third quartile (Q3) is the 75th percentile, which is higher than the 67th percentile and the median.

67th percentile: The 67th percentile is above the median but below the third quartile.

 

Thus, the correct increasing order is:

 

Median (50th percentile) < Sixth decile (60th percentile) < 67th percentile < Third quartile (75th percentile).

 

The correct answer is (C) B, A, D, C.

Question 15
Match List–I with List–II:List–I (TSS and RSS)A. RSS = 5, TSS = 20B. RSS = 5, TSS = 25C. RSS = 10, TSS = 25D. RSS = 12, TSS = 32List–II (R² of Regression Model)(I) 0.62(II) 0.75(III) 0.8(IV) 0.6Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
  • C.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)

The correct answer is (B) A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)

Question 16
A substitute for the gestural communication over the Internet is the use of:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Emoticons
  • B.Infographics
  • C.Photographs
  • D.Anonymous attachments
Correct Answer: Emoticons

Option (A) is the correct answer.

Emoticons (like 🙂, 😢, 😡) are text-based facial expressions or symbols used in digital communication to convey emotions, gestures, or tone, acting as a substitute for non-verbal cues like gestures and facial expressions in face-to-face interactions.

 

Example: Typing 😊 instead of smiling physically in a conversation.

 

Other options are incorrect:

(B) Infographics – Used for visual data presentation, not emotional or gestural communication.

 

(C) Photographs – They show visual content but do not substitute for real-time gestures in conversation.

 

(D) Anonymous attachments – Refers to files shared without identifying the sender; unrelated to gestural cues or emotional tone.

Question 17
The production and distribution of news by ordinary people is referred to as:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Popular journalism
  • B.Common journalism
  • C.Citizen journalism
  • D.New journalism
Correct Answer: Citizen journalism

Citizen journalism refers to the gathering, reporting, and sharing of news by ordinary individuals, not professional journalists.

 

It typically involves people using phones, blogs, social media, or videos to report events, especially when mainstream media may be absent.

 

Example: A person live-streaming a protest or sharing real-time updates from a disaster zone.

Question 18
The important characteristics of Internet communication are:A. Absence of sub-mediaB. Multi-data networkingC. High fidelity realismD. Sophisticated reciprocityE. Non-interactiveChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.C, D and E Only
  • D.A, D and E Only
Correct Answer: B, C and D Only

The correct answer is option (B), i.e., B, C and D Only.

 

Let’s evaluate each statement in terms of internet communication characteristics:

 

A. Absence of sub-media

– Incorrect. Internet communication integrates multiple sub-media (text, audio, video, animation). So, sub-media are very much present, not absent.

 

B. Multi-data networking

– Correct. Internet enables simultaneous transmission of multiple data types – text, images, video, sound – across networks.

 

C. High fidelity realism

– Correct. With advancements like HD video, real-time voice, and 3D visuals, internet communication can now closely mimic real-life interactions.

 

D. Sophisticated reciprocity

– Correct. This refers to the two-way, interactive nature of internet communication, like in chats, emails, video calls, forums, etc.

 

E. Non-interactive

– Incorrect. Internet communication is highly interactive, unlike traditional mass media (e.g., TV or radio).

Question 19
The features of media audience are:A. Inaccurate media coverage may mislead active audiencesB. Audiences consume media content on the expectation of rewardC. Infotainment can be a dysfunctionD. Audiences are uniform for all mediaE. The new media do not provide variety of contents to audienceChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, C and D Only
  • B.A, B and C Only
  • C.C, D and E Only
  • D.A, D and E Only
Correct Answer: A, B and C Only

The correct answer is option (B).

Let’s evaluate each statement to understand the features of media audiences:

 

A. Inaccurate media coverage may mislead active audiences

– Even active, critical audiences can be misled by misinformation or biased reporting, especially when credibility is assumed.

 

B. Audiences consume media content on the expectation of reward

– As per the Uses and Gratifications Theory, audiences seek media for rewards like entertainment, information, or emotional satisfaction.

 

C. Infotainment can be a dysfunction

– Infotainment (mix of information + entertainment) may lead to superficial understanding or sensationalism, making it a potential dysfunction of media.

 

D. Audiences are uniform for all media

– Incorrect. Audiences are diverse, vary by platform, content, region, and interest. There is no single "uniform" audience.

 

E. The new media do not provide variety of contents to audience

– Incorrect. New media (internet, social media, streaming platforms) offer a vast variety of content, more than traditional media.

Question 20
MatchList–IwithList–II:List–I(Medium)A. Video-on-demandB. Datacasting on InternetC. CinemaD. TelevisionList–II(Characteristic)(I) Absence of being live(II) ‘There and then’ production(III) Nowness(IV) InvocationalChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
  • C.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)

The correct answer is option (D), i.e., A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III).

 

A. Video-on-demand → (IV) Invocational

Video-on-demand (like Netflix or Hotstar) allows personalized, on-demand access, invoking user control, choice, and engagement. It invokes the audience to actively select, pause, resume, unlike passive formats.

 

B. Datacasting on Internet → (I) Absence of being live

Datacasting often involves pre-recorded, pre-produced data streamed over internet (e.g., lecture videos, weather updates). It generally lacks the liveness of a real-time event.

 

C. Cinema → (II) ‘There and then’ production

Cinema is produced with extensive planning, scripted, and consumed at a specific venue and time – hence, ‘there and then’.

 

D. Television → (III) Nowness

Television, especially live news and events, delivers a strong sense of nowness, being consumed in real time by a large audience.

Question 21
Find the next term in the series given below:2, 10, 30, 68, 130, ?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.200
  • B.222
  • C.100
  • D.175
Correct Answer: 222

Next second difference: 24 + 6 = 30

 

Next first difference: 62 + 30 = 92

 

Next term: 130 + 92 = 222

Question 22
A man deposited some amount of money in a bank at some simple rate of interest for 3 years. Had he deposited the money at 2% higher rate of interest, he would have fetched ₹360 more. Find the amount deposited in the bank.(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.₹6200
  • B.₹7000
  • C.₹6500
  • D.₹6000
Correct Answer: ₹6000

P(R+2)×3100-P×R×3100 = 360

or P×2×3100 = 360

or P = 6000

Question 23
A man can do a piece of work in 8 days and another man can do the same work in 10 days. How long should it take both A and B working together but independently?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.6 days
  • B.449days
  • C.415days
  • D.512days
Correct Answer: 449days

Let total work be 40 units.

First man can do 5 units per day while second can do 4 units per day.

Together they can do 9 units per day

No of days to finish the work = 409 = 4 49 days

Question 24
Find the value of the following expression:[(0.22 × 0.22 × 0.22) + (0.022 × 0.022 × 0.022)] ÷ [(0.66 × 0.66 × 0.66) + (0.066 × 0.066 × 0.066)].(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.227
  • B.125
  • C.127
  • D.123
Correct Answer: 127

[(0.22 × 0.22 × 0.22) + (0.022 × 0.022 × 0.022)][(0.66 × 0.66 × 0.66) + (0.066 × 0.066 × 0.066)] = 0.0223(1000+1)0.0663(1000+1) = 127

Question 25
If ‘CONSTABLE’ is coded as 91 and ‘STABLE’ is coded as 59, then how shall ‘PORTABLE’ be coded?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.89
  • B.109
  • C.111
  • D.110
Correct Answer: 89

C O N S T A B L E → 3 + 15 + 14 + 19 + 20 + 1 + 2 + 12 + 5 = 91

P O R T A B L E → 16 + 15 + 18 + 20 + 1 + 2 + 12 + 5 = 89

Question 26
"If Anup is a member of Animal Rights Society, then he opposes horse racing. Anup opposes horse racing, therefore, he is a member of Animal Rights Society". Which fallacy is committed in the above argument?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Hasty generalisation
  • B.Inappropriate authority
  • C.Affirming the consequent
  • D.Denying the antecedent
Correct Answer: Affirming the consequent

The correct answer is: (C) Affirming the consequent

 

The argument follows this structure:

If Anup is a member of Animal Rights Society (P), then he opposes horse racing (Q).

Anup opposes horse racing (Q).

Therefore, Anup is a member of Animal Rights Society (P).

 

This is a classic case of the fallacy of affirming the consequent, which assumes that because the result (Q) is true, the condition (P) must also be true. But that is logically invalid — Q could be true for other reasons.

Question 27
If the statement "No squares are circles" is given as true, which of the following statements can be immediately inferred to be false?A. Some circles are not squaresB. All squares are circlesC. Some squares are circlesD. Some squares are not circlesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.A and C only
  • D.A, B and D only
Correct Answer: B and C only

If E is given as true THEN A is false; I is false; O is true.

Hence “B. All squares are circles” and “C. Some squares are circles” are False.

Question 28
Which of the following two propositions can neither be both true together nor can they be false together?A. All squares are rectanglesB. Some squares are rectanglesC. No squares are rectanglesD. Some squares are not rectanglesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and D only
  • B.B and D only
  • C.C and D only
  • D.A and C only
Correct Answer: A and D only

Two propositions are contradictories if one is the denial or negation of the other—that is, if they cannot both be true and cannot both be false. Two standard-form categorical propositions that have the same subject and predicate terms but differ from each other in both quantity and quality are contradictories. Here “A. All squares are rectangles” (Type A) and “D. Some squares are not rectangles” (Type O” are Contradictory.

Question 29
From the following, identify the propositions that are logically equivalent:A. No plants are animalsB. No animals are plantsC. All plants are non-animalsD. All non-animals are plantsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and D only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.A, B and C only
  • D.A and C only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

“No plants are animals” and “No animals are plants” are CONVERSION of each other.

All plants are non-animals is OBVERSION of No plants are animals.

Question 30
As per classical Indian School of Logic (Nyāya), verbal testimony (śabda pramāṇa) includes:A. Only injunctive sentencesB. Words of a scriptureC. Words of any teacherD. Words of a trustworthy personChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and C only
  • B.B and D only
  • C.A and B only
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: B and D only

The correct answer is option (B) - B and D only.

 

In the Nyāya school of classical Indian philosophy, Śabda (verbal testimony) is recognized as a valid source of knowledge (pramāṇa). According to Nyāya:

 

Śabda is verbal testimony from a trustworthy person (āpta-vākya).

 

It includes words of scriptures (like the Vedas), which are considered apauruṣeya (not of human origin) and thus infallible.

 

It does not restrict śabda to only injunctive sentences or to any teacher indiscriminately—only a reliable or authoritative source is valid.

Question 31
In computing, which of the following is a program downloaded and installed on a computer that appears harmless, but is in fact, malicious?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Trojan Horse
  • B.Time Bomb
  • C.Worm
  • D.Logic Bomb
Correct Answer: Trojan Horse

The correct answer is option (A) - Trojan Horse.

 

A Trojan Horse is a type of malicious software that disguises itself as a legitimate or harmless program to trick users into installing it. Once installed, it can perform harmful actions like stealing data, opening backdoors, or damaging files.

Question 32
Which of the following pair of acronyms and their expansion is incorrectly matched?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.SIM – Subscriber Identity Module
  • B.SMTP – Simple Mail Transfer Plan
  • C.SQL – Structured Query Language
  • D.URL – Uniform Resource Locator
Correct Answer: SMTP – Simple Mail Transfer Plan

The correct answer is option (B) SMTP – Simple Mail Transfer Plan

 

SMTP actually stands for Simple Mail Transfer Protocol, not "Plan".

 

The other acronyms are correctly matched:

 

SIM – Subscriber Identity Module

 

SQL – Structured Query Language

 

URL – Uniform Resource Locator

Question 33
Identify the correct order of the following storage devices A–D as per their increasing data storage capacity:A. DVDB. Hard DiskC. CDROMD. Blu-Ray DiskChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.C, A, D, B
  • B.A, C, D, B
  • C.B, D, C, A
  • D.C, A, B, D
Correct Answer: C, A, D, B

The correct answer is option (A) - C, A, D, B.

 

Increasing Order of Storage Capacity:

CD-ROM (C) – ~700 MB

 

DVD (A) – ~4.7 GB

 

Blu-Ray Disk (D) – ~25 GB (single layer)

 

Hard Disk (B) – 100s of GB to several TB

 

This is the correct ascending order of data storage capacity.

Question 34
Which of the following statements are true in the context of Web Conferencing?A. It uses the Internet to permit conferencing to take place.B. Multiple computers are used with this system, all connected over the Internet.C. Delegates cannot leave the conference once they join.D. It is carried out in real-time.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and B Only
  • B.A, B and C Only
  • C.C and D Only
  • D.A, B and D
Correct Answer: A, B and D

Correct answer: (D) A, B and D

 

Let's evaluate each statement:

 

A. It uses the Internet to permit conferencing to take place.

 

True. Web conferencing is conducted over the Internet.

 

B. Multiple computers are used with this system, all connected over the Internet.

 

True. Participants join from different devices via Internet connectivity.

 

C. Delegates cannot leave the conference once they join.

 

False. Participants can leave a web conference at any time.

 

D. It is carried out in real-time.

 

True. Web conferencing is a form of real-time communication.

 

So, only A, B, and D are correct.

Question 35
Match List–I with List–II.List–I (ICT Term)A. SoftwareB. Web BrowserC. PDAD. FirewallList–II (Meaning)I. The software that accesses and displays pages on the web.II. A mechanism that isolates a network from the rest of the Internet, permitting only specific traffic to pass in and out.III. A set of computer programs that enables hardware to perform different tasks.IV. A small mobile computing device.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A–I, B–III, C–IV, D–II
  • B.A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III
  • C.A–III, B–I, C–IV, D–II
  • D.A–I, B–III, C–II, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–III, B–I, C–IV, D–II

The correct answer is option (C) - A–III, B–I, C–IV, D–II.

 

A. Software → III. Software is a set of computer programs that enables hardware to perform various tasks.

 

B. Web Browser → I. A web browser accesses and displays web pages (e.g., Chrome, Firefox).

 

C. PDA → IV. A Personal Digital Assistant is a small mobile computing device.

 

D. Firewall → II. A firewall acts as a barrier between a trusted internal network and untrusted external networks, controlling incoming and outgoing traffic.

Question 36
Excess presence of which one of the following in drinking water can elevate the blood pressure of humans?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Sulphate
  • B.Zinc
  • C.Lead
  • D.Copper
Correct Answer: Lead

The correct answer is option (C) - Lead.

 

Excessive lead in drinking water can lead to high blood pressure, as well as other health issues. Lead is a toxic substance, and prolonged exposure, especially in drinking water, can be harmful to the cardiovascular system and can cause other long-term health effects.

Question 37
Which of the following are released significantly during combustion of coal?A. Sulphur dioxideB. NOxC. FlyashD. AmmoniaChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.A, B and D Only
  • C.C, D and E Only
  • D.A, B and E Only
Correct Answer: A, B and C Only

Coal combustion is a dirty process, releasing a range of pollutants including sulphur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, carbon dioxide, volatile organic compounds, ash and a range of heavy metals. If these are not controlled, they can enter the atmosphere, causing damage to the environment and to human health.

Question 38
Match List–I with List–II.List–I (Water treatment)A. PrimaryB. SecondaryC. TertiaryD. AdvancedList–II (Process)I. Removal of wastes with the help of activated charcoal etc.II. Ozonization and disinfection by ultraviolet rays.III. Removal of large pieces such as stick, stone, rags, plastic etc.IV. Removal after flocculation and coagulation of wastes.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A–III, B–IV, C–II, D–I
  • B.A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II
  • C.A–II, B–III, C–I, D–IV
  • D.A–II, B–III, C–IV, D–I
Correct Answer: A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II

The correct matching for water treatment processes is:

 

A. Primary – III. Removal of large pieces such as stick, stone, rags, plastic etc.

 

B. Secondary – IV. Removal after flocculation and coagulation of wastes.

 

C. Tertiary – I. Removal of wastes with the help of activated charcoal etc.

 

D. Advanced – II. Ozonization and disinfection by ultraviolet rays.

Question 39
Which of the following is/are Environmental Hazard(s) due to Geothermal Power Plants?A. Noise pollutionB. Production of SO₂ and NOₓC. Production of H₂S (toxic gas)D. Production of CO₂Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A Only
  • B.B and D Only
  • C.C Only
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

The correct answer is option (D) - A, B, C and D.

 

Geothermal power plants can contribute to various environmental hazards such as:

 

A. Noise pollution – The operation of geothermal plants can generate significant noise due to the turbines and other machinery.

 

B. Production of SO₂ and NOₓ – Sulfur dioxide (SO₂) and nitrogen oxides (NOₓ) can be released during the operation, especially if the geothermal source contains sulfur.

 

C. Production of H₂S (toxic gas) – Hydrogen sulfide (H₂S) is a toxic gas commonly released from geothermal sources.

 

D. Production of CO₂ – Geothermal plants may also emit carbon dioxide (CO₂), although the levels are much lower compared to fossil fuel-based power plants.

 

Each of these can be potential environmental hazards from geothermal power plants.

Question 40
Which of the following indices represents the background level of noise pollution?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.L10
  • B.L25
  • C.L50
  • D.L90
Correct Answer: L90

The correct answer is option (D) - L90.

 

In the context of noise pollution, L90 represents the background level of noise. It is the noise level exceeded for 90% of the time, effectively indicating the quietest levels in an environment, where most of the time, noise levels are lower than this value.

Question 41
A 'SWAYAM' course is classified based on the engagement of number of _______ and number of video hours.(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.semesters
  • B.months
  • C.weeks
  • D.years
Correct Answer: weeks

The SWAYAM (Study Webs of Active Learning for Young Aspiring Minds) platform offers MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses) developed by institutions like IITs, NPTEL, IGNOU, etc.

 

Each course on SWAYAM is classified based on:

  • Number of weeks of engagement
  • Number of video hours

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 42
The ancient buildings named Ratnasagara, Ratnadadhi and Ratnaranjaka were part of which of the following university of ancient India?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Takshashila
  • B.Odantapuri
  • C.Nalanda
  • D.Sridhanya Katak
Correct Answer: Nalanda

The correct answer is option (C) - Nalanda.

 

Ratnasagara, Ratnadadhi, and Ratnaranjaka were ancient buildings associated with the famous Nalanda University, which was one of the first residential universities in the world and a major center of learning during ancient times.

Question 43
Value based education shall include universal human values such as:A. IsolationB. Non-violenceC. PeaceD. Righteous conductE. Punishment to crimeChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.C, D and E Only
  • D.A, C and E Only
Correct Answer: B, C and D Only

The correct answer is option (B) - B, C and D Only.

 

Value-based education emphasizes teaching universal human values such as non-violence, peace, and righteous conduct. These values promote moral and ethical behavior among students.

Question 44
Find out the correct chronological sequence of the establishment of the colleges mentioned below:A. Daly CollegeB. St. Stephen’s CollegeC. Bengal National CollegeD. Bengal Technical InstituteE. St. Xavier’s College (Calcutta)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.C, E, D, B, A
  • B.D, A, B, E, C
  • C.E, B, A, D, C
  • D.B, A, E, C, D
Correct Answer: E, B, A, D, C

The correct match is given below.

 

E. St. Xavier’s College (Calcutta) – 1860

B. St. Stephen’s College – 1881

A. Daly College - 1895

D. Bengal Technical Institute - 1905

C. Bengal National College – 1906

Question 45
MatchList–IwithList–II:List–I(Commissions)A. Knowledge CommissionB. Council of Education (Pre-Independence)C. Hunter CommissionD. Kothari CommissionList–II(Major Recommendation)(I) Grants for collegiate education(II) Improvement of teaching at the university level(III) Establishment of 50 National Universities(IV) Setting up a university in BengalChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
  • C.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)

Let's analyze the commissions and their major recommendations:

 

Knowledge Commission (2005–2009):

 

The major recommendation of the Knowledge Commission was the establishment of 50 National Universities to improve higher education in India.

 

Recommendation: (III) Establishment of 50 National Universities.

 

Council of Education (Pre-Independence):

 

This council focused on education reforms in British India and recommended setting up a university in Bengal, which led to the creation of the University of Calcutta in 1857.

 

Recommendation: (IV) Setting up a university in Bengal.

 

Hunter Commission (1882):

 

The Hunter Commission recommended grants for collegiate education to improve higher education in India during the British period.

 

Recommendation: (I) Grants for collegiate education.

 

Kothari Commission (1964–1966):

 

The Kothari Commission recommended the improvement of teaching at the university level and the promotion of better standards of higher education.

 

Recommendation: (II) Improvement of teaching at the university level.

 

Thus, the correct match is:

 

(C) (A)-(III), (B)-(IV), (C)-(I), (D)-(II)

Question 46
Read the passage and answer the following questions:The beginning of the 15th century opened a new horizon for Oriya poets. It coincided with the most glorious period of Oriya history. Kapilendra Dev (1434–1467), a worthy son of the Orissan soil, usurped the kingdom from the hands of the 'Gangas', a southern dynasty, and became the monarch of Orissa. He conquered vast territories of the southern peninsula up to the Krishna river in the south and Gulbarga in the west, and united people of many languages under one administration. His victory in a number of battles created an atmosphere of self-confidence in the Oriyas as a heroic nation, and they directed their attention to improving their language and literature. As a result, a great poet like Sarala Das emerged from the society. King Kapilendra Dev also encouraged his people to write in Oriya and he himself included one Oriya poem in his Sanskrit workParashurama Vyayogaand accepted Oriya as the state language, in place of Sanskrit and Tamil, and he issued a number of royal orders in Oriya. His ardent love for Jagannatha and his full dependence on Him, contributed a lot to bring about a creative atmosphere.Which monarch is credited with opening a new horizon for Oriya poets at the beginning of the 15th century?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Kapilendra Dev
  • B.Sarala Das
  • C.Tulsidas
  • D.Kalidasa
Correct Answer: Kapilendra Dev

The passage clearly states:

 

"The beginning of the 15th century opened a new horizon for Oriya poets... Kapilendra Dev (1434–1467), a worthy son of the Orissan soil... united people... encouraged his people to write in Oriya... and accepted Oriya as the state language."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 47
Read the passage and answer the following questions:The beginning of the 15th century opened a new horizon for Oriya poets. It coincided with the most glorious period of Oriya history. Kapilendra Dev (1434–1467), a worthy son of the Orissan soil, usurped the kingdom from the hands of the 'Gangas', a southern dynasty, and became the monarch of Orissa. He conquered vast territories of the southern peninsula up to the Krishna river in the south and Gulbarga in the west, and united people of many languages under one administration. His victory in a number of battles created an atmosphere of self-confidence in the Oriyas as a heroic nation, and they directed their attention to improving their language and literature. As a result, a great poet like Sarala Das emerged from the society. King Kapilendra Dev also encouraged his people to write in Oriya and he himself included one Oriya poem in his Sanskrit workParashurama Vyayogaand accepted Oriya as the state language, in place of Sanskrit and Tamil, and he issued a number of royal orders in Oriya. His ardent love for Jagannatha and his full dependence on Him, contributed a lot to bring about a creative atmosphere.What was one of the significant cultural impacts of Kapilendra Dev's victories and unification of diverse peoples?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.The decline of the Oriya language
  • B.The rise of Sanskrit language
  • C.The encouragement of Oriya literary composition
  • D.The prohibition of all regional languages
Correct Answer: The encouragement of Oriya literary composition

The passage highlights that after King Kapilendra Dev’s victories and unification of various regions:

 

"His victory in a number of battles created an atmosphere of self-confidence in the Oriyas as a heroic nation, and they directed their attention to improving their language and literature."

"Kapilendra Dev... encouraged his people to write in Oriya... accepted Oriya as the state language... issued royal orders in Oriya."

 

This clearly shows that a significant cultural impact was the promotion of the Oriya language and literature.

Question 48
Read the passage and answer the following questions:The beginning of the 15th century opened a new horizon for Oriya poets. It coincided with the most glorious period of Oriya history. Kapilendra Dev (1434–1467), a worthy son of the Orissan soil, usurped the kingdom from the hands of the 'Gangas', a southern dynasty, and became the monarch of Orissa. He conquered vast territories of the southern peninsula up to the Krishna river in the south and Gulbarga in the west, and united people of many languages under one administration. His victory in a number of battles created an atmosphere of self-confidence in the Oriyas as a heroic nation, and they directed their attention to improving their language and literature. As a result, a great poet like Sarala Das emerged from the society. King Kapilendra Dev also encouraged his people to write in Oriya and he himself included one Oriya poem in his Sanskrit workParashurama Vyayogaand accepted Oriya as the state language, in place of Sanskrit and Tamil, and he issued a number of royal orders in Oriya. His ardent love for Jagannatha and his full dependence on Him, contributed a lot to bring about a creative atmosphere.Kapilendra Dev's martial expeditions expanded Orissa’s dominion up to which fluvial boundary in the South?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Godavari
  • B.Krishna
  • C.Kaveri
  • D.Tungabhadra
Correct Answer: Krishna

The passage clearly states:

 

"He conquered vast territories of the southern peninsula up to the Krishna river in the south and Gulbarga in the west..."

 

This indicates that the Krishna River was the southern boundary of Kapilendra Dev's conquests.

Question 49
Read the passage and answer the following questions:The beginning of the 15th century opened a new horizon for Oriya poets. It coincided with the most glorious period of Oriya history. Kapilendra Dev (1434–1467), a worthy son of the Orissan soil, usurped the kingdom from the hands of the 'Gangas', a southern dynasty, and became the monarch of Orissa. He conquered vast territories of the southern peninsula up to the Krishna river in the south and Gulbarga in the west, and united people of many languages under one administration. His victory in a number of battles created an atmosphere of self-confidence in the Oriyas as a heroic nation, and they directed their attention to improving their language and literature. As a result, a great poet like Sarala Das emerged from the society. King Kapilendra Dev also encouraged his people to write in Oriya and he himself included one Oriya poem in his Sanskrit workParashurama Vyayogaand accepted Oriya as the state language, in place of Sanskrit and Tamil, and he issued a number of royal orders in Oriya. His ardent love for Jagannatha and his full dependence on Him, contributed a lot to bring about a creative atmosphere.In ParashuramaVyayoga, how did Kapilendra Dev show his support for the Oriya language?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.By writing the entire work in Oriya
  • B.By including an Oriya poem
  • C.By translating it into multiple languages
  • D.By prohibiting Sanskrit and Tamil languages
Correct Answer: By including an Oriya poem

From the passage:

 

"...he himself included one Oriya poem in his Sanskrit work Parashurama Vyayoga..."

 

This directly confirms that Kapilendra Dev supported the Oriya language by integrating it into his own Sanskrit literary work, showcasing its value and promoting its usage in official and cultural contexts.

Question 50
Read the passage and answer the following questions:The beginning of the 15th century opened a new horizon for Oriya poets. It coincided with the most glorious period of Oriya history. Kapilendra Dev (1434–1467), a worthy son of the Orissan soil, usurped the kingdom from the hands of the 'Gangas', a southern dynasty, and became the monarch of Orissa. He conquered vast territories of the southern peninsula up to the Krishna river in the south and Gulbarga in the west, and united people of many languages under one administration. His victory in a number of battles created an atmosphere of self-confidence in the Oriyas as a heroic nation, and they directed their attention to improving their language and literature. As a result, a great poet like Sarala Das emerged from the society. King Kapilendra Dev also encouraged his people to write in Oriya and he himself included one Oriya poem in his Sanskrit workParashurama Vyayogaand accepted Oriya as the state language, in place of Sanskrit and Tamil, and he issued a number of royal orders in Oriya. His ardent love for Jagannatha and his full dependence on Him, contributed a lot to bring about a creative atmosphere.Kapilendra Dev's devotion to which deity contributed to the creative atmosphere in Orissa?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Shiva
  • B.Vishnu
  • C.Jagannath
  • D.Lakshmi
Correct Answer: Jagannath

The passage clearly states:

 

"His ardent love for Jagannatha and his full dependence on Him, contributed a lot to bring about a creative atmosphere."

 

This indicates that King Kapilendra Dev’s deep devotion to Lord Jagannath was a major factor in inspiring literary and cultural creativity during his reign.

Quiz Attempt #119715

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following Table-1 shows the readership of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines (in lakh) of four different categories, namely, General, Sports, Film, and Business from the year 2020 to 2023 and Table-2 shows the number of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines of same four categories published during the same period. No magazine was discontinued during the above mentioned period. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follows:What is the approximate average readership per magazine in 2022?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.13615
  • B.14600
  • C.12805
  • D.15715
Correct Answer: 13615

Total readership in 2022 = 17.7 lakhs

Total Magazines = 130

Average readership = 17.7130 = 0.13615 lakh = 13615

Question 2
The following Table-1 shows the readership of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines (in lakh) of four different categories, namely, General, Sports, Film, and Business from the year 2020 to 2023 and Table-2 shows the number of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines of same four categories published during the same period. No magazine was discontinued during the above mentioned period. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follows:The difference between the number of magazines published in 2022 and 2020 is:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.50
  • B.44
  • C.52
  • D.56
Correct Answer: 50

Total for 2020 = 44 + 10 + 14 + 12 = 80

Total for 2022 = 64 + 22 + 24 + 20 = 130

Difference = 130 – 80 = 50

Question 3
The following Table-1 shows the readership of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines (in lakh) of four different categories, namely, General, Sports, Film, and Business from the year 2020 to 2023 and Table-2 shows the number of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines of same four categories published during the same period. No magazine was discontinued during the above mentioned period. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follows:From the year 2020 to 2021, if P is the difference between the number of Hindi magazines and Q is the difference between the number of English magazines published, then P : Q is:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.2 : 3
  • B.1 : 2
  • C.1 : 1
  • D.2 : 1
Correct Answer: 1 : 1

2020 Total (H) = 20 + 4 + 8 + 4 = 36

2021 Total (H) = 28 + 6 + 12 + 6 = 52

So, P = 52 − 36 = 16

 

2020 Total (E) = 24 + 6 + 6 + 8 = 44

2021 Total (E) = 30 + 10 + 10 + 10 = 60

So, Q = 60 − 44 = 16

Ratio = 16 : 16 = 1 : 1

Question 4
The following Table-1 shows the readership of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines (in lakh) of four different categories, namely, General, Sports, Film, and Business from the year 2020 to 2023 and Table-2 shows the number of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines of same four categories published during the same period. No magazine was discontinued during the above mentioned period. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follows:In the year 2021, as against the year 2020, the number of readers per magazine declined for the category of _________ magazine.(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.General
  • B.Sports
  • C.Business
  • D.Film
Correct Answer: Business

For business magazine there was a decline

2020: Readers = 0.6 + 0.3 = 0.9, Magazines = 8 + 4 = 12

Readers/mag = 0.9 / 12 = 0.075

 

2021: Readers = 0.8 + 0.32 = 1.12, Magazines = 10 + 6 = 16

Readers/mag = 1.12 / 16 = 0.07

Question 5
The following Table-1 shows the readership of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines (in lakh) of four different categories, namely, General, Sports, Film, and Business from the year 2020 to 2023 and Table-2 shows the number of Hindi (H) and English (E) magazines of same four categories published during the same period. No magazine was discontinued during the above mentioned period. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follows:Considering only the English sports magazines, the ratio between the number of readers in 2020 to the number of readers during 2020 to 2023 is:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.2 : 9
  • B.1 : 8
  • C.2 : 15
  • D.2 : 5
Correct Answer: 1 : 8

Total 2020–2023 English readers for sports = 0.8 + 1.2 + 2.0 + 2.4 = 6.4 lakh

Required ratio = 0.86.4 = 1 : 8

Question 6
Which component of Baddeley’s basic working memory model is involved in the task of pressing keys on a keypad in a clockwise pattern?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Visuospatial sketchpad
  • B.Bounded rationality
  • C.Phonological loop
  • D.Metacognition
Correct Answer: Visuospatial sketchpad

The correct answer is option (A) i.e., Visuospatial sketchpad

 

In Baddeley’s Working Memory Model, the visuospatial sketchpad is the component responsible for:

 

  • Visual and spatial information processing

 

  • Keeping track of locations, shapes, and movement patterns

 

The task of pressing keys on a keypad in a clockwise pattern involves:

 

  • Remembering the spatial layout of the keys

 

  • Following a spatial sequence

 

This clearly uses the visuospatial sketchpad.

Question 7
What is the name of Swayamprabha’s Channel No. 40?(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Vyas
  • B.Spandan
  • C.Aryabhatt
  • D.Kautilya
Correct Answer: Vyas

The name of Swayamprabha’s Channel No. 40 is Vyas.

Question 8
Which of the following are the primary goals of PM e-Vidya?A. To provide free text-books to all studentB. To facilitate multi mode access to digital/online teaching-learning contentC. To offer scholarships to topper studentsD. To facilitate the uniqueness with its comprehensive accessibility for allE. To benefit learners in remote areas where stable internet is not availableChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, C and E only
  • B.A, D and E only
  • C.B, D and E only
  • D.C and D only
Correct Answer: B, D and E only

PM e-Vidya is an initiative by the Government of India launched under the Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan to unify all efforts related to digital/online/on-air education to enable multimodal access to quality education.

 

Let’s evaluate the given options:

 

A. To provide free text-books to all students

This is not a core goal of PM e-Vidya. Free textbooks fall under other schemes like the NCERT distribution.

 

B. To facilitate multi mode access to digital/online teaching-learning content

This is a primary goal — PM e-Vidya promotes DIKSHA, SWAYAM, TV Channels, radio, and podcasts.

 

C. To offer scholarships to topper students

Scholarships are not part of PM e-Vidya. They are offered under other schemes like NSP (National Scholarship Portal).

 

D. To facilitate the uniqueness with its comprehensive accessibility for all

PM e-Vidya emphasizes inclusivity — accessible formats for divyang (specially-abled) learners and multilingual content.

 

E. To benefit learners in remote areas where stable internet is not available

Through TV (One Class One Channel) and radio (Shiksha Vani), it supports learners with limited or no internet access.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 9
MatchList–IwithList–II.List–I(Tool / Softwares)A. PlotagonB. MindmeisterC. GithubD. MentimeterList–II(Applications)(I) To create Pre-and-post-session polls to gauge student learning from each session(II) To create instant animated videos(III) To understand and make connections between concepts, ideas and information(IV) To store, share, and work together with others to write codeOptions:(UGC NET 28 Aug 2024 Evening)
